abstract: This paper presents the optimal tuning of proportional plus integral controller of hydro-thermal power system for load frequency control. Tuning of proportional plus integral controller's parameters with various optimization techniques like Particles Swarm Optimization (PSO) optimization, Gravitational Search Algorithm GSA) and Firefly Algorithm (FA) have been done using two different performance indices as objective functions. Power mismatch between overall generation to the total load plus system losses may results in variation of frequency from their desired value and also causes variation in interconnected tie-line power flow. System performance has been analysed with step load change in hydro-thermal system. Simulation results reveal the performance of all the three optimization techniques in terms of Tie-line power and the frequency deviation in both the areas. Comparison has also been made between the two different performance indices criteria (IAE, ITAE). © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Video Stabilization Through Target Detection
dc:creator: Vrma K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Defence Research and Development Organisation India

abstract: Visual communication or video processing needs video stabilization as a pre-requisite for applications like computer vision or visual tracking. Most of the visual tracking algorithms assume that the input video is stabilized. It is very hard to find any available literature of visual tracking which takes unstabilized video as input for target detection and tracking. It is observed that most of the videos recorded using hand-held camera or camera mounted on a vehicle (tank, ship, aircraft) suffer from unstabilization due to the unwanted hand/vehicle motions coupled with the camera. Target detection is a prime requirement for visual tracking. A novel algorithm is developed which auto-detects the target and uses these parameters to stabilize the video itself. This developed algorithm calculates the local and global motion vectors simultaneously. Local motion vector is used for target detection/tracking while global motion vector is used for video stabilization. Target of interest is identified in frame and different samples of target are taken around the target coordinate. These target samples are then deposited in positive and negative repositories using classifier method. Training of samples of object is carried out for the detection of object coordinate in the next frame. Object coordinate difference between current and just previous frame provides the intentional motion. Consecutive image frames are compensated to get digital video stabilization. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Evaluation and Research Directions in Nature-Inspired Algorithms
dc:creator: Sachan R.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Nature-inspired algorithms are commonly used for solving the various optimization problems. In the past few decades, various researchers have proposed a large number of nature-inspired algorithms. These algorithms have proved to be very efficient as compared to other classical optimization methods. Not every algorithm is suited for all kind of problem. Some scores over others. In this paper, an attempt has been made to summarize seven nature-inspired algorithms that shall pave way for any new entrant to easily understand the journey so far. The purpose of this review is to present a short study of seven nature-inspired algorithms based on its source of inspiration, control parameters, features, variants and area of application where these algorithms have been successfully applied. The performance of these algorithms is tested on five unconstrained benchmark functions of different characteristics. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Deep Learning Method for the detection of Diabetic Retinopathy
dc:creator: Chakrabarty N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Many Diabetic patients suffer from a medical condition in the retina of the eye known as Diabetic Retinopathy. The main cause of Diabetic Retinopathy is high blood sugar levels over a long period of time in the retina known as Diabetes Mellitus. The primary goal is to automatically classify patients having diabetic retinopathy and not having the same, given any High-Resolution Fundus Image of the Retina. For that an initial image processing has been done on the images which includes mainly, conversion of coloured (RGB) images into perfect greyscale and resizing it. Then, a Deep Learning Approach is applied in which the processed image is fed into a Convolutional Neural Network to predict whether the patient is diabetic or not. This methodology is applied on a dataset of 30 High Resolution Fundus Images of the retina. The results, so obtained are a 100 % predictive accuracy and a Sensitivity of 100 % also. Such an Automated System can easily classify images of the retina among Diabetic and Healthy patients, reducing the number of reviews of doctors. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Modified Notch Filter Based Control for Wind Energy Generation System Integrated to Single-Phase Weak Grid
dc:creator: Gupta T.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this paper, a modified notch filter (MNF) based control algorithm is proposed for power quality improvement in single phase utility grid integrated wind energy generation system (WEGS) under abnormal grid conditions. A MNF based control is designed for fundamental component extraction. The main objective of the system is to develop a reliable, secure and safe integration for mitigation of various power quality issues like current harmonics distortion, DC offset rejection. The perturb and observe (PO) based maximum power point tracking algorithm is used to achieve maximum power. For validation of the system operation, tests are conducted on a prototype developed in the laboratory under different conditions like distorted grid voltage, sag/swell and variable wind speed conditions. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Organic Solar Cell: Operating Principle, Performance Parameters, Structures and Its Advantages
dc:creator: Najam S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Extracting sun's energy to produce electricity has proved itself to be one of the best solutions to the world energy crisis. This is solved because solar cell can provide electricity at lower cost and almost no pollution. It is very demanding and rapidly growing field for future technology to produce power at low cost. Firstly, silicon solar cells came in the markets that were working efficiently, later on organic solar cells evolved, they outshone their economical and ecological advantages. Therefore, this paper presents various aspects of solar cell for electricity production. Subsequently, it gives the brief introduction and working principle of organic solar cells (OPV). Besides this, classification of different solar cell structures is also discussed in depth because structure of OPV has significant impact on the performance. In addition to this, several other recent advancements are also presented that shows how materials and structures make a difference on the efficiency of organic solar cells. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A flexible copper incorporated carbon nanofiber grown activated carbon cloth as anodes for sodium ion batteries
dc:creator: Pandey I.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Long term eco-friendly and cost-effective energy storage system is one of the important parameter to make successful portable and wearable electronics. In the era of sustainable and clean energy storage system, sodium ion batteries are good alternative of lithium ion batteries. 3-D interconnected nanocarbons embedded with metal open a market of stable, room temperature operated flexible batteries. Among the reported 3-D interconnected nanocarbons, carbon nanofibers are inexpensive and proven to be high capacity anode material for batteries. Herein, novel copper nanoparticles incorporated 3-D interconnected carbon nanofibers grown cloth used as hybrid anode. This hybrid architect anode gives superb electrochemical performance via providing ample of interlayer distance which balances the volume change and enhances the electrode/electrolyte contacts by minimizing the sodium ion diffusion distance. This flexible hybrid anode exhibits high specific 490.2 mA h g                             <sup>-1</sup>                             at a current density 0.1 A g                             <sup>-1</sup>                             and stable cycle life 715                             <sup>th</sup>                             cycles with 99.9% columbic efficiency.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A novel Fast Alterable Duty (FAD) MPPT procedure for Solar PV Hybrid Vehicles
dc:creator: Husain M.A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Solar PV powered Hybrid vehicles need a maximum power point tracking (MPPT) scheme which should have a capability of extremely fast tracking performance required during fast varying atmospheric conditions and shading due to the presence of trees, buildings on road sides. This paper presents a new maximum power point tracking technique for PV system with extremely fast convergence speed and restricted searching area. This will increase the tracking efficiency and overall performance of the PV based system. Assessment and comparison of the proposed MPPT algorithm are done with Perturb and Observe (PO) method. A 250 Watt PV system was simulated and analysed. Finally, the practical results were obtained using the hardware set up made for 250 Watt PV Panel and Arduino microcontroller development board. The results show that the proposed Fast Alterable Duty (FAD) MPP Tracking technique is substantially better than PO. The attractiveness of this scheme is the limit imposed on the range of voltage, this range of voltage is where the operating points try to remain even if the atmospheric conditions change at a fast rate. This range of voltage keeps on updating according to the real time values of panel temperature and Irradiance. Enhancement in speed is observed because of this limit imposed on voltage range and also because of the novel variable duty step size (Duty of DC-DC converter used) proposed in this article. This new maximum power point tracking technique will result in extremely fast tracking with increased efficiency. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Development of EMT Model for Circulating Current Control
dc:creator: Yadav A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The structure of the modular multilevel converter (MMC) gives it an edge with respect to other converter topologies. Being in its early phase, MMC is still evolving in term of architecture, modelling and the control philosophy. Contributing to same, this paper presents the electromagnetic-transient (EMT) model on real-time digital simulator (RTDS) platform and the detailed small-signal model of MMC along with control structure. Results of both models have been compared. Further, along with the stability analysis, necessity and impact of the circulating current controller have also been investigated. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Parallel Manipulator control using different LQG tuning methods
dc:creator: Choubey C.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this paper, Maryland parallel manipulator is being examined, having 3-degrees-of-freedom (DOF). For the dynamic analysis, three different sequential trajectories are considered. The major concern is the nonlinearities and disturbances, which are always associated with the parallel manipulators and it is observed that the process and measurement noise can be rejected by using Linear-Quadratic-Gaussian (LQG) controller. For the designing and to control the trajectory of the examined manipulator, the weighting matrices Q R must be optimally selected. Three different methods for tuning Q R weighted matrices are proposed i.e. (i) Trial and Error, (ii) Algebraic Approach and (iii) Genetic Algorithm (GA). The performance analysis of LQG is being simulated by MATLAB. Finally, after designing and tuning of LQG the results of all three different methods of tuning are compared, and it are found that in case of LQG-GA the trajectory tracking is better and efficient as compared to other two methods. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Three Party Key Sharing Protocol Using Polynomial Rings
dc:creator: Chaturvedi A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: All of us know that authentication and key agreement are the two cryptographic services very important for data communication. People use online methods for information exchange using various wireless communication channels. Intruders want to steal sensitive useful information and they use different cryptanalysis ways for that. Quantum computing methods also produces danger for all the existing protocols and algorithms. So at this point of time, it is essential that researchers find new and innovative protocols for data communication in order to surprise intruders. In this paper we present three party key sharing protocol and its correctness involving polynomial rings. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Design of Out Pipe Crawler for Oil Refinery based on Analysis Classification of Locomotion and Adhesion Techniques
dc:creator: Mishra D.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In the current industrial situation, inspection of pipelines at an inaccessible region in refinery during plant shutdown is performed manually using huge scaffoldings, which involves significant time and money and are a hazardous task for human beings as well. In this paper, we have designed a robot as an automated crawler for movement over pipeline terrain. These designed crawlers certainly have to move in vertical direction carrying some payload to perform their assigned task accurately at a specific height. To accomplish the above-discussed conditions, climbing crawler must possess a certain set of rules related to locomotion and adhesion of the robot for slip-free and smooth motion over a vertical pipeline. Based on literature survey and comparative analysis on shape, size, energy efficiency and mobility of different robots with mechanical examination of different characteristics of design with locomotion technique a compliant, encapsulated caged type wheel-driven robot with gripping adhesion mechanism has been developed and tested in this research, with payload capacity of about 200 gms over a ferromagnetic pipeline of scale used in different oil or gas refineries. The developed and tested encapsulated caged prototype crawler presented in this paper has cost-effectiveness as its major distinctive feature with small in size and simple in structure. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Image Watermarking Scheme using Homomorphic Transform in Wavelet Domain
dc:creator: Khare P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: In order to protect various types of digital data from malicious users a new watermarking scheme comprising of homomorphic transform, Discrete Wavelet Transform (DWT) and Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) is introduced in this paper. Properties of homomorphic transform and DWT are exploited along with SVD. DWT is applied on reflectance component obtained from homomorphic transform of host image. Then watermark is directly embedded with singular values (SVs) of its LL subband. Imperceptibility and robustness of proposed scheme is tested with numerous attacks such as scaling, sharpening, noise etc. Comparative analysis among presented and existing technique is done and it is observed that proposed scheme is superior over to them. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Modeling and Simulation of Compact Feeder Pillar System
dc:creator: Zanje S.R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: A feeder pillar box (FPB) or power box is mainly composed of a set of busbars, three-phase electrical panels, terminations connectors, fuses, covers, and enclosure is modelled and evaluated. This paper enlists various type of Multiphysics simulation of the complete system and at sun- component levels to tackle the engineering challenges that accompanied the creation of this radical new design. Among the various proposed configurations of feeder pillars, a compact vertical feeder pillar is modelled and simulated as per the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) standard test requirement and evaluated in terms of accuracy and ease-of-use. The simulations models are designed to evaluate the short circuit withstanding capability of the FPB system and temperature rise under full loading condition that has helped to redesign the FPB system configuration with the lowest footprint possible. In additions, the FEM model is created to assure the structures integrity of the entire system that includes enclosures, three phase panels, novel termination connectors and fuses housing. The models so developed are validated experimentally with an in-house developed prototype. Based on the model, a simulation methodology is developed and used to perform analysis for various type test requirements. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: High Speed and Low Power Sensing Amplifier based on MTJ
dc:creator: Upadhyaya Y.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Zakir Husain College of Engineering and Technology

abstract: The pre-charge sense amplifier (PCSA) offers good trade-off between reliability, efficiency and performance. The hybrid combination in PCSA gives better result due to non-volatile nature of Magnetic Tunnel Junction. In this paper, performance of proposed Sense Amplifier (SA) has been evaluated in terms of delay and power and compared with another Sense amplifier (SA). The proposed double tail sense amplifier (DTSA) consumes 11.162 μW and 0.3405 fJ energy at the supply voltage of 0.75V. This proposed comparator can operate at high frequency. The simulations is produced to investigate its process variation with help of Monte Carlo method. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Review and Analysis of Electric Spring for Power Quality improvement
dc:creator: Srivastava A.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In this paper a new device which will make our loads smart will be discussed. With introduction of electric spring the problems which arise due to intermittent nature of renewable energy source will be removed to a great end. This paper will also show the shift in the method of reactive power control and how it is better than previous methods. It will be shown that how this new paradigm that is the load demand follow the power generation will help in reactive power control. This paper will concern with how this device will improve power quality in isolated networks and how it can be used in electrical power systems where power is generated with use of renewable sources. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Comparative Analysis of Optimized Algorithms for Ontology Clustering
dc:creator: Tiwari A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida

abstract: Every organization has to deal with abundant of data in its day-to-day proceedings. With time and work this collection of raw data and information also keeps growing. For reasons like decision making, finding co-relations or figuring out differences among the data it is mandatory to traverse through the whole huge collection of data. Examining such huge data collections or complex ontologies in context of semantic web may take too long and will be additional overhead. Along with extra time period it may occupy larger space as well. To replace the already existing data mining techniques another simpler approach has been introduced known as Clustering. Clustering is the scheme of placing together similar items in one cluster and separating the dis-similar ones. Clustering technique decomposes complex ontologies into simpler small data sets. These decomposed data sets save time and memory when it comes to information retrieval or query processing in semantic web. This paper proposed two optimized algorithms K-ENRICH and FC-ENRICH for ontology clustering and comparative analysis of these algorithms with some existing algorithms using various attributes that are F-measure, similarity and entropy. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: PiScanner: Economical User-driven Context based OCR Translator
dc:creator: Pandey V.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Education is the most important medium in terms of raising awareness levels of individual, society and country as a whole. However, for under-developed and developing countries, language diversity from international community is posing an important hurdle in their progress. It has been well-established that every individual's best intellectual ability is reflected through his/her mother tongue. So, to bridge the gap of global advancements and to capture research essence of international dominion comprehendible to various native languages, this paper proposes an approach of context-based translation, and unifying it with OCR-scanning function in a simplified architecture. The proposed architecture is further developed as PiScanner for economical and convenient OCR-scanning with context-based translation functionality and new language support, which is rarely available. PiScanner's architecture additionally supports text-to-speech conversion, with Google's text-to-speech APls, to provide audio output of context-based translated text for visually-challenged individuals. PiScanner has been thoroughly experimented to demonstrate its applicability. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Target Detection and Tracking in Infrared Videos Using Frequency Domain Analysis and Machine Learning for Surveillance
dc:creator: Verma K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Defence Research and Development Organisation India

abstract: Military surveillance during pitch dark night conditions is of prime importance for the security of any nation. Medium Wave Infra Red (3-5μm) or Long Wave Infra Red (8-12μm) thermal cameras are used in the border areas for reconnaissance. Automatic target detection and tracking in these Infra Red (IR) videos is very important for alertness and preaction. This paper presents an algorithm for detecting and tracking a target in IR video. IR image characteristics are utilized for the detection of target using Fast Fourier Transform, followed by Boosted Butterworth high pass filter to sharpen the image and increase the contrast between the target and its surroundings. Then proper thresholding and blob analysis is performed to detect the target. Then target is tracked using centroid matching function. Machine learning concept is used to develop trajectory prediction algorithm with dynamic indexing of weight of rate of change in angle with respect to the horizontal axis to handle both linear and non-linear trajectories. Experimental results show that the developed algorithm is robust for target detection and tracking in IR videos and is capable of handling human as well as vehicle targets moving in linear or non-linear fashion. The algorithm successfully predicts the target even if the target is occluded partially or fnlly over several frames. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Comparison Parameters and Evaluation Technique to Help Selection of Right IaaS Cloud
dc:creator: Ghule D.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: While most of the enterprises workloads are moving to cloud infrastructure, choosing the right cloud infrastructure is a challenge for the organizations. The list of parameters to be considered, prioritization of these parameters and assigning the right weightage for correct selection of cloud infra is crucial for performance. Objective of this paper is to come up with suggestive list of parameters and a Comparison framework for evaluation and selection of Infrastructure as a Service Clouds (IaaS). The selection become precise if an exhaustive list of parameters is used and correct priority and weightage is assigned to each one of them. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance Investigation of Cylindrical Double Gate Junctionless FET
dc:creator: Singh B.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: G.B. Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment

abstract: The paper proposes a TCAD simulation based comparative study of cylindrical double gate junctionless (CDGJLFETs) and cylindrical single gate junctionless FETs (CSGJLFETs). The CDGJLFETs show better results than CSGJLFETs in terms of subthreshold current, channel potential, threshold voltage roll off, subthreshold swings and analog parameters due to better control of gates over the channel. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Frame Context Dependency of Intra-Prediction Modes of H.265/HEVC: An Analytical Study
dc:creator: Asif M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The continuous increase of applications supporting the Ultra High Definition (UHD) resolution limits the use of current video coding standard (Advance Video Coding) AVC. To provide the considerably better coding efficiency as compared to the existing video coding standards, a next generation video coding standard High Efficiency Video Coding (HEVC) is released. HEVC introduces the concept of flexible Coding Unit (CU) size, and the number of intra-prediction angular modes i.e. 35. The newly introduced features highly contribute to the better performance of HEVC, but they also significantly increase the computational complexity. In this paper, a frame context based study of intra-prediction modes is carried out to investigate the behavior of different modes over different context frames, so that, the HEVC complexity reduction work can be abetted. As a performance metric, the frequency of different modes over different textured images and Sum of Absolute Difference (SAD) for randomly selected Prediction Blocks (PBs) are pictorially presented. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Speech Signal De-noising using Wavelet Transform and Different Standard Softwares: Performance Evaluation and Comparisons Study
dc:creator: Lavi
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Speech signal processing is used in many applications. There exist situations where conversation takes place under high noise environment. A specific example is the telephonic conversations held at airport with background aeroplane sound. Other examples are the conversation held in industrial environment with high noise machines, in railway stations etc. In all of these conditions, conversation (voice signal) get corrupted by background sound (noise) reducing its intelligibility. Thus, the need arises for an effective method that helps in reducing the background noise thereby increasing clarity of the conversation. Wavelet Transform (WT) is widely used for audio, image and video signal processing. This paper presents a wavelet-based approach to reduce the effect of background noise. This approach is compared with the standard, freely available softwares such as Audacity, Wavepad and Ocenaudio which are widely used for the purpose of noise reduction. The AWGN (Additive White Gaussian Noise) is assumed to be a model of background noise. Using extensive simulation study and analysis which is carried out using MATLAB                             <sup>®</sup>                             2016a, WT based approach is found to perform better than the other standard softwares that are considered here. Correlation co-efficient is considered as a measure of performance improvement by the WT approach over the other software. The work has useful implications in various applications in which speech signal gets degraded by background noise.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Optimal Scheduling of Customers' Demand based upon Power Availability and its Price in Smart Grid
dc:creator: Reddy M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This study concentrates on modeling of customer load scheduling of delayable and non-delayable appliances. Considering a group of 20 customers with a Distribution Channel (DC) acts as an Aggregator, which are willing to participate in Demand response (DR) and in Energy Market (EM). Firstly, each customer load scheduling of appliances is done with Delayable Appliances and Non-Delayable Appliances using forecasted Day-Ahead Price, where Non-Delayable Appliance can reduce their power and Delayable Appliances can delay their operation time with in the time period limit set by the customer in a day. The cumulative load information goes to Distribution channel which re-adjusts again only Delayable Appliances. Distribution Channel adjustment is divided into two cases, viz., first with respect to available power and, second with respect to the price of power at that time. Some customers are having solar PV as a generation with battery storage. The scheduling of appliances is assumed as an optimization problem and solved through Genetic Algorithm Optimization (GAO). The results from Day-ahead and Hour-ahead scheduling can help in matching closely load for real-time consumption. This method has social benefits, which benefits the customer as well as utility. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Hexagonal Boron Nitride: A Material Odyssey for the High Performance of OTFTs
dc:creator: Pal S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Organic material based devices have been profusely investigated and have gained much attention due to their advantages it endeavors in terms of large area, low-cost flexible electronic devices. In order to improve performance of organic field effect transistors, it requires several engineering process of which one important factor is to reduce charge trap centers near the organic semiconductor (OSC)-dielectric interface. This paves the importance of dielectric material in the field of flexible electronics. In this paper, various novel structures of OTFTs based on hexagonal Boron Nitride (h-BN) as dielectric layer have been demonstrated. The thin film transistor based on Pentacene as OSC on a h-BN as dielectric layer is analyzed and exhibit an electric field dependent mobility of 0.56 cm                             <sup>2</sup>                              V-                             <sup>1</sup>                             s                             <sup>-1</sup>                              with an improved current on/off ratio of 10                             <sup>6</sup>                              with low operating gate voltage. Besides this, it is found that the improvement in the performance of various structures of OTFT with h- BN based material can serve as an excellent dielectric for flexible electronics applications in comparison to silicon dioxide (SiO2).                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Off-line Signature Verification through Machine Learning
dc:creator: Rateria A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Signature is a depiction of a person's name that is used as his/her identity proof, but it can be forged. Therefore, genuineness of a signature needs to be verified. In the present paper for verifying the o□ine signature, a small 3-layer deep convolutional neural network followed by a fully connected layer is proposed, whose trainable parameters are several orders of magnitude fewer than previously reported in literature. This network has been used in two dierent configurations: firstly as a feature extractor in hybrid classifier and secondly as an end to end classifier in Siamese network. In hybrid classifier scheme, support vector machine is used for verifying the genuineness of the signature. Siamese network contains two or more identical subnetworks joined by one or more fully connected layers. The proposed neural network is used as subnetwork in Siamese network. Both hybrid classifier and Siamese network are tested for both Writer independent (WI) and dependent (WD) verification on 3 datasets: CEDAR, GPDS Synthetic Signature, BHSig260. The proposed approach achieves percentage accuracy of 99.91, 92.28, 86.88, 90.58 in Hybrid classifier scheme, 99.87, 92.14, 86.33, 90.80 in Siamese network for WD verification and 80.26, 75.06, 89.33, 82.42 in Siamese network for WI verification in CEDAR, BENGALI, HINDI and GPDS respectively. Experimental results show that the verification accuracy for HINDI in WI outperforms the state of art approaches. The proposed approach has also achieved comparable performance in CEDAR and BENGALI for WD verification. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: BFrWF: Block-based FrWF for coding of high-resolution images with memory-complexity constrained -devices
dc:creator: Tausif M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Zakir Husain College of Engineering and Technology

abstract: A typical image coder generally consists of a transform stage followed by quantization and coding stages. The memory requirement of an image coder would be the maximum of both the stages and complexity would be the sum of both stages. Due to large memory requirements, most of the existing image coders are unsuitable for their implementation on memory-constrained-platforms especially for high-resolution images. In this paper, we propose a low memory approach, Block-based Fractional Wavelet Filter (BFrWF), to compute wavelet transform coefficients of high-resolution images. Furthermore, BFrWF can be combined with low memory wavelet-based image coding algorithms to design low-memory image codec. Evaluation results show that the BFrWF requires less than 10 kB of RAM (available over most of the low-cost sensor nodes) even for high-resolution (HR) images, thus making it suitable for visual sensor networks. Moreover, the proposed BFrWF implemented with 8 blocks has 25.64                             <sup>%</sup>                              less complexity than FrWF and 80.45% less complexity than segmented FrWF (SFrWF) implemented with partitioning of an image line into 8 segments (SFrWF - a low memory variant of FrWF) for HR-image of dimension 2048×2048.                          © 2018 IEEE.
author-keyword: Fractional wavelet filter and sensor nodes

dc:title: Compression of Medical Images using their Symmetry
dc:creator: Srivastava M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Compression of an image involves reducing its size to some extent without much changes in its quality and the contents. Compression of medical images plays a significant role in the field of telemedicine. For example, treatment of patients at places where specialized doctors are not available requires transmission of the medical images to places where the required doctors are available. Since medical data is huge in size, it requires high bandwidth at both the sender side as well as the receiver side. Compressed medical images can also be stored in a standard database which may be accessed by doctors and researchers for their case studies. It has already been proved that mostly the human body possess bilateral symmetry. This means that an organ of the human body can be divided into two symmetrical halves by simply drawing a vertical line down their centers. This paper presents a new approach for compressing the medical images by making use of their symmetry feature. This approach helps in compressing the medical images to a greater extent. This method involves transmission of any one of the symmetrical half of the image along with the differential information of the two halves in encoded form. At the receiver end, the original image can be regenerated without much observable changes. The proposed approach also determines the best pair of compression techniques for encoding the two parts of the image to be transmitted. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Frequency Reconfigurable Compact Multi-Band Printed Monopole Antenna Using Capacitively Loaded Loops
dc:creator: Bansal M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this paper, a compact microstrip-fed multi-band frequency reconfigurable monopole is realized by utilizing capacitively loaded loops (CLLs) with embedded PIN diodes as loading elements. Depending on the ON / OFF state of the PIN diodes on the CLLs, quad-band / penta-band / hexa-band characteristics can be achieved from the proposed antenna. All the operating bands exhibit quasi-monopolar omni-directional characteristics, with satisfactory gain performance. The proposed multi-band frequency reconfigurable antenna can be deployed for cognitive radio applications, as well as wireless access points or portable hand-held devices. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Novel Structure for Piezoelectric Based MEMS Energy Harvester
dc:creator: Chamuah A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology

abstract: A novel structure has been designed to be used as piezoelectric Micro Electro Mechanical Systems (MEMS) energy harvester. A deep investigation has been made for the selection of the piezoelectric material and also for the design of the structure. Finally, the structure of a 'Jaw Harp' is used and 'Rochelle Salt' is applied as the piezoelectric material. Numerous simulations and analytical calculations have been performed in the process of optimizing the device performance by varying its various parameters. Towards the end, a very appreciable result have been achieved. A remarkable output electric potential of 0.12 V has been generated by the harvester on application of 1 N m                             <sup>-2</sup>                              pressure at the free vibrating end of the device.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: FPGA Based Power Flow Control of Grid Side Converter of DFIG Wind Energy System
dc:creator: Naresh M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Now a days, the most important part of the DFIG technology at wind power generation systems. The power generation processes the capability of riding through the grid. The performance of the GSC of DFIG connected WT to develop the PFC is achieved during unbalance load conditions with an AC-DC-AC power converter. The proposed system is FPGA Based Power Flow Control of GSC of DFIG based WES. The power conversion is also operational with AC to DC to AC PWM converters combined during a DC-link voltage. A generated reference frequency is synchronized with PLL. FPGA is used for designing the controller of PLL. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Design and Analysis of Grid-Interactive DFIG Based WECS for Regulated Power Flow
dc:creator: Puchalapalli S.V.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper presents a grid-interactive doubly fed induction generator (DFIG) based wind energy conversion system (WECS) for regulated power flow through the grid. The battery energy storage (BES) is used for maintaining regulated power along the grid regardless of the wind speeds. The rotor side converter (RSC) is controlled in flux based reference frame and the grid side converter (GSC) control is based on an indirect vector control. The BES is connected at DC bus of two voltage source converters integrated back to back, which plays key role in attaining regulated grid power. This work proposes control algorithms for both RSC and GSC to achieve regulated power flow capabilities in the grid. The system is modeled and its performance is simulated under variable wind speeds, change in grid reference real and reactive powers, grid voltage dip and unbalanced nonlinear load conditions using SimPowerSystems toolbox of MATLAB. Under all such cases, the grid currents, stator currents and PCC (point of common coupling) voltages are found sinusoidal and THDs (total harmonic distortions) are under limits as per the IEEE 519 standard. Finally, a prototype is developed and experiment has been carried out to test the grid-interactive DFIG based WECS under changeover of grid power and variable wind speeds. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Comparative Analysis of Photonic Bandgap and Transmittance in ID Photonic Crystals
dc:creator: Mishra U.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this article, the variation of photonic bandgap and transmittance for one-dimensional dielectric periodic layered structure with angles of incidence have been studied. It gives the working of s-polarized electromagnetic wave, as tunable s-polarized filter, which stops the p-polarized wave. Two material structures Air/AgNO                             <sub>3</sub>                             and Air/Pb2O, have been studied. The transmittance in (Air/Pb                             <sub>2</sub>                             O) has been found to be better. Transmission of the wave best appears at increase in incidence angle.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Integration of Electric Vehicle and Renewable Generation to Improve the Power Quality Problems in Distribution System
dc:creator: Yadav T.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The most important power quality impact of electric vehicle and renewable generation are variability and uncertainty of renewable generation and this problem can be overcome by using the integration of Electric-Vehicles (EVs) and Renewable Energy Sources (RESs) into the electric power system. To overcome these drawbacks and enhance the security and reliability levels of renewable energy sources along with their inter-connected networks. Hybrid renewable energy sources comprising of two or more energy conversion methods are acquired. Integration of plug-in electric vehicle (PEV) and renewable energy sources in power system is used to minimize the cost of grid-operation. To mitigate the variability of renewable energy sources and reduce the cost of grid operation, the storage capability of PEVs could help power systems. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Numerical Investigation of the Effect of Blade Profile of a Darrieus Hydrokinetic Turbine
dc:creator: Saini G.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Department of Hydro and Renewable Energy

abstract: Darrieus based turbines have been used since decades for wind power generation. Nowadays, peoples are paying more attention toward the use of this turbine to harness the hydrokinetic potential. The profile of the blade is the main parameter to decide the power output of Darrieus hydrokinetic turbine. Therefore, an attempt has been made to select a suitable blade profile for Darrieus hydrokinetic turbine in order to enhance the power output. Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) based numerical analysis has been carried out in a commercial available software (ANSYS Fluent (v.18.1)). Four different blade profiles (two symmetrical and two unsymmetrical) namely NACA 0018, NACA 0010, S 9000 and S 1046 are selected for comparative study. 2D Numerical investigations are carried out around the Darrieus hydrokinetic turbine rotor and SST k-ω turbulence model has been used for the solution of Reynolds averaged Navier-Stokes equations. The fluid flow distributions of pressure and velocity around the turbine blades corresponding to each profile is analyzed and discussed. Based on the numerical analysis, it is concluded that un-symmetrical S-1046 blade profile is found to be the superior airfoil in terms of power coefficient and self-starting capability. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: SyRG-PV-BES Based Standalone Microgrid Using Appoximate Multipliers Based Adaptive Control
dc:creator: Sharma R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: To maximize practical reliability and ability of the distributed generations (DGs), this paper managed to design, control and hardware authentication of novel adaptive algorithm. The proposed approximate multiplier least mean square (AMLMS) control algorithm for an off-grid voltage source converter (VSC) system is effective for reduction of power disturbances without disturbing the power quality (PQ). Moreover, the VSC control algorithm focuses on reduction of complexity of LMS by adding multipliers in the finite impulse response (FIR) filter and in updating coefficient in circuitry. Moreover, a synchronous reluctance generator (SyRG) based pico-hydropower generation at the AC side is used because of its reliability, and cost-effectiveness than other brushless generators. The VSC control is projected for islanded microgrid comprising of photovoltaic (PV) array, and a bidirectional DC-DC converter (BDC) at the DC side. The BDC with a storage battery, maintains the optimal power flow to provide the power equilibrium between load and sources through DC bus voltage regulation. Moreover, BDC mitigates the second harmonic current from the battery charging and discharging current. Experiment results ensure the validation and effectiveness of nronosed controller. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Panorama Generation from a Video
dc:creator: Dawn S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Video Panorama is a complete view of an object that is generated by aligning and blending a sequence of images. A video sequence consists of several hundred frames, and as a result, creating a panoramic image from these frames is a challenging task because video may have moving objects and the objects may appear at different depths. Computer vision is a field that includes methods for acquiring, processing, analyzing, and understanding images and, in general, high-dimensional data from the real world in order to produce numerical or symbolic information. One of the sub domain is generating panoramas from video which have applications in aero photography, satellite generated photographs to be stitched for research. Our aim is to design a Panorama Generation System that takes a video as input and captured by a moving camera navigating through a scene and our goal is to generate a panoramic summary of the scene and for this purpose remove moving and foreground objects. The panorama process receives two dimensional video from video camera. The received video includes set of image frames and the frames together form a panorama image. To build panorama image from video, we use the motion model based on color invariant features in order to apply our algorithm in a scene where there are illumination, highlights and shadows. After that, key frames/regions are selected for the following image fusion process. At last, the input frames are transformed to the same coordinate to fuse a panorama. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Netra: Smart Hand Gloves Comprises Obstacle Detection, Object Identification OCR Text to Speech Converter for Blinds
dc:creator: Srivastava N.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Shri Ramswaroop Memorial College of Engineering & Management

abstract: Visually Impaired Person Have to Face lot of Problems in their day to day life. They can not walk anywhere alone, there should be someone who can assist them. They also suffer from the problem of reading any Text and they could not identify any object around them. Smart glove described in this paper overcome all the Problems. This glove can detect any obstacle in the Path of blind person and can warn them. So that it ensures their safety. Also it work as a artificial eyes for them. This glove can extract text from any image which contains text and can convert text into speech. So that blinds can easily hear the text which they can not see. One more feature of this glove allows the blinds to identify the objects around them. The experimental results show good accuracy. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Prediction of Consumer Behaviour using Random Forest Algorithm
dc:creator: Valecha H.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In the ultramodern age of technology, anticipation of market trend is very important to observe consumer behaviour in this competitive world as trends are volatile. Building on developments in machine learning and prior work in the science of behaviour prediction, we construct a model designed to predict the behaviour of Consumer. The aim of this research paper is to examine the relation between consumer behaviour parameters and willingness to buy. First we investigate to find relationship between consumer behaviour to buy products on changing parameters such as environmental factor, organizational factor, individual factor and interpersonal factor. Thus this paper proposes time-evolving random forest classifier that leverages unique feature engineering to predict the behaviour of consumer that affect the choice of purchasing the product significantly. Results of random forest classifier are more accurate than other machine learning algorithm. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Model Reduction of Linear Dynamical MIMO Systems by Using Balanced Realization and Moment Matching Algorithm
dc:creator: Prajapati A.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper exhibits the use of recently proposed mixed model reduction method to a MIMO power system model. This method is a combination of two popular model reduction methods which are balanced realization and factor division methods. It is used to overcome the problem of balanced realization technique such as steady state problem. In this method, the balanced realization technique is used for evaluating the denominator of the simplified system and the numerator is derived by factor division algorithm. This methodology guarantees the stability of the reduced system and preservation of static behavior of the original model. A standard multi-variable system is taken from the literature for illustrating the effectiveness of the suggested technique. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Voltage and Frequency Regulation with Load Leveling of a PMSG Based Pico-Hydro System Using SLMS Control Algorithm
dc:creator: Chandran V.P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This work deals with voltage and frequency control (VFC) of a permanent magnet synchronous generator (PMSG) based pico-hydro system with the load levelling. In this proposed system, a bi-directional DC-DC converter (BDC) with a battery energy storage (BES) is coupled to to voltage source converter (VSC). A bi-directional converter, whose input is BES, is used to control the DC-link voltage of the VSC. Along with the DC-link voltage, it also maintains active power balance in the system. The BDC enables to use a BES with reduced rating of 250V, while the DC-link voltage is always maintained at 380 V. The battery provides load leveling by charging during lightly loaded conditions. When the connected load exceeds more than PMSG based pico-hydro generation, then the excess power is delivered by the BES. The power quality improvement of the system along with VFC is realized using a VSC. The VSC along with VFC also takes care of other power quality problems like harmonics and load unbalancing. A sparse least mean square (SLMS) based control algorithm is used to estimate fundamental component of load currents and to generate reference source currents for VSC control. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Detection of Ovarian Cancer using Organic Light Emitting Diodes
dc:creator: Negi S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Graphic Era Deemed to be University
Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: The modern world has been affected by a lot of diseases, and day by day new ones keeps on emerging. But no disease has threatened the mankind as much as cancer has. The reason behind it is that it has taken more human lives than any other disease. According to data of American Cancer Society, in USA alone half a million people will die because of cancer in 2018. Further this disease has a lot of different types which affects a whole lot of people varying in age and gender. Cancer even after all this is still a curable disease, but the problem with it that makes it so dangerous is late detection. If detected at early stages it can very easily be treated. Ovarian cancer is one of the categorization of cancer which has a very low survival rate often because of late detection and diagnosis. In this article a non invasive sensor mechanism has been proposed for detection of ovarian cancer. This method will result in a portable device that can be used for giving an early diagnosis of ovarian cancer and can easily be used at home. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Systematic Design of Dual-band MIMO Antenna using Characteristic Mode Analysis
dc:creator: Singh H.V.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Dr. SPM International Institute of Information Technology

abstract: In this paper, Characteristic mode analysis is used to design a dual-band (WLAN and WiFi) MIMO antenna. A step by step design procedure is discussed for a proposed structure using CMA modal significance. By analyzing Characteristic angle, eigenvalues and modal significance in systematic design approach, help us to achieve good S                             <sub>11</sub>                              (<-10dB) and S                             <sub>21</sub>                              (<-15dB) in the desired bands. In the presented work first single band MIMO antenna is evolved by identifying desired resonating modes and undesired non-resonating modes using CMA. The desired single band is achieved by tuning the non-resonating modes in the design. The presence of undesired non-resonating modes influence the mutual coupling between the antenna, and as a result of that, it diminished the performance of MIMO antenna. To minimize the impact of mutual coupling; Defected Ground Structure (DGS) and stubbing in the ground plane is introduced. The proposed design shows good envelope correlation coefficient (ECC), diversity gain, and Gain in the operating bands.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Micro-controller based Water Pumping System using Solar Energy
dc:creator: Singh P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In the article, a micro-controller based water pumping system using stand-alone solar energy source is presented. Solar energy is greatly created through photovoltaic (PV) technique. This micro-controller based water pumping system using Solar Photovoltaic (SPV) energy is mainly utilizes for irrigation purpose in this study. Inclusion of battery can be an economic solution for this application. The aim of this article is to present how to achieve a cost efficient water pumping system for field irrigation. Results and their analysis are discussed with this case study of irrigation pumping unit. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Future of Graphene based Interconnecte Technology - A Reality or a Distant Dream
dc:creator: Kumbhare V.R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Dr. S. P. Mukherjee International Institute of Information Technology - Naya Raipur

abstract: In the era of advanced sub-micron technology, the on-chip interconnect primarily dominates the overall system performance. This paper critically addresses the impact of technology advancement and spacing on crosstalk induced delay and peak noise for copper and multi-layered graphene nanoribbon (MLGNR) based global on-chip interconnects. In order to demonstrate the crosstalk effect, this paper presents the multi-conductor transmission line (MTL) model of MLGNR that can be further simplified to an equivalent single conductor (ESC) model with a negligible tolerance below 0.91% irrespective of interconnect lengths and spacing. Using the proposed ESC model, the crosstalk induced delay and noise are analyzed for a coupled driver-interconnect-load setup. It is observed that the MLGNR possesses a negligible crosstalk effect at an advanced technology node in comparison to Cu interconnects. At 14 nm technology node, the overall crosstalk induced delay of MLGNR can be reduced by 48.1% with respect to Cu in comparison to 32 nm node at global interconnect lengths. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A New Information Hiding Approach using Haar- Transformation
dc:creator: Halder T.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College, Durgapur

abstract: In this paper a new data hiding approach in frequency domain has been proposed. While hiding secret information, bit plane slicing and particle swarm optimization(PSO) approach have been used. Secret bits are categorized according to their importance by bit plane slicing method. In order to find appropriate area within the cover image, mapping is applied. The combined approach of PSO and bit plane slicing hides secret bits according to their importance. While mapping, the most matching area, which is expected to be least affected due to modification, is chosen. To ensure that the noise level is not too high, the proposed method is compared with other existing methods. Peak signal to noise ratio (PSNR) and histogram comparison is used as a quality measurement technique. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance analysis of Rotated Square Sierpinski Gasket (RSSG) fractal antenna for wireless communication
dc:creator: Devesh
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Here, a neoteric Fractal Microstrip patch antenna (MSA) has been proposed using Rotated Square Sierpinski Gasket (RSSG) structure. The key contribution of this article is to design a reduced size of MSA using modified Sierpinski gasket structure and to achieve multiband applications. The parametric performance of RSSG fractal antenna has been completed using HFSS simulation software. The antenna resonates at different frequencies at 6.95 GHz, 15.77 GHz, 18.24 GHz, 20.91 GHz and 25.63 GHz bands, respectively. The multiband behavior of the designed antenna is obtained which works well for C-band, Ku- band, and K-band Application. The simulated result shows that the proposed technique outperforms conventional approaches significantly. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Impact of Different Organic Semiconductor Materials on Performance of Dual Gate OTFT
dc:creator: Singh V.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Graphic Era Deemed to be University

abstract: Organic electronics is predicted as future candidate for organic industries. This paper presents the effect of different material on the performance of dual-gate organic thin film transistor (DG-OTFT) using Atlas TCAD simulator. In this paper Copper (II) phthalocyanine (CuPC), Diketopyrrolopyrole-naphthalene (PDPP-TNT) are considered as p-type organic semiconductor, whereas, F                             <sub>16</sub>                             CuPC and Buckminsterfullerene (C60) as n-type semiconductor for device performance analysis. The analysis is done by varying the material used for the organic semiconducting layer, keeping all the other structural parameters fixed. The devices were analyzed based on their ION/IoFF ratio, maximum drain current I                             <sub>D</sub>                             , threshold voltage V                             <sub>T1</sub>                             , sub-threshold voltage V                             <sub>T2</sub>                             and their trans-conductance G                             <sub>M</sub>                             . The paper compares the results obtained from the analysis to determine the most suitable organic semiconductor (OSC) for dual gate OTFTs.                          © 2018 IEEE.
author-keyword: Dual gate organic thin film transistor

dc:title: No-Reference Image Quality Assessment of Blur and AWGN Contaminated Images Utilizing Colour Features
dc:creator: Khan M.U.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Zakir Husain College of Engineering and Technology

abstract: Blur and additive white Gaussian noise are the two very common and dominant distortions in digital images. In this paper a No-reference image quality assessment (NR-IQA) technique is proposed which can estimate the quality of the images having these two distortion types covering entire subjective quality range. In the proposed method, derivative statistics and sharpness measurement are applied on the two colour spaces HSV (hue, saturation, value) and Lab ((Luminance, a and b colour channel) to extract the prediction features. The extracted features are fed to the support vector regressor (SVR) for training purpose. The experimental results shows the predicted quality score of the trained model are highly correlated to human visual system (HVS). © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: FPGA Implementation of 32 Bit Complex Floating Point Multiplier Using Vedic Real Multipliers with Minimum Path Delay
dc:creator: Rao K.D.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Floating point Complex numbers multiplication is an essential operation in DSP and communication applications with high speed and less power requirement. Hence, this paper presents an IEEE 754 format 32 × 32 bit complex floating point multiplier using four floating point real multipliers solution with minimum path delay. Each 32 bit real floating multiplier requires a 24 bit fixed point real multiplier for mantissa multiplication. Based on the Indian Vedic mathematics sutra called URDHVA TIRYAKBHYAM, two architectures for 24×24 bit Vedic real multiplier are proposed for mantissa multiplication in 32 bit floating point real multiplier. The two architectures are evaluated to choose one having less path delay for use in the proposed complex floating point multiplier. The four floating point real multipliers solution for the proposed multiplier is coded in VHDL for implementation on Kintex-7 FPGA. Finally, the results of the proposed multiplier are compared with that of the Booth and Array multipliers. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Revamping an Accelerometer calibration System-A 'Better-than-New' Approach
dc:creator: Chauhan J.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Defence Research and Development Organisation India

abstract: Typically accelerometers are employed in ground tests, the results of which form part of input to airworthiness checks and therefore need performance reverification at specified or regular intervals for measurement and control. Towards the objective, sensor calibrations are performed using comparison method at Calibration Laboratory where the setup consists of electro-dynamic shaker which has an armature with attached reference sensor. The reference accelerometer's armature had become non functional since the coil got damaged and therefore not available for calibration tasks. Support services not being offered by Original Equipment Manufacturer or other sources due to obsolescence is common scenario and it poses several challenges and opportunities. Approach and efforts taken towards ameliorating the situation involve analysing past constraints, root cause studies and implementing corrective actions, additional software development, hardware rectification, overcoming re-calibration fixture issues etc. to reinduct the system successfully into service. The simple philosophy to make the facility' Better than New' with tasks involving creating an inventory of parts, development of specialised tooling, software and control procedure adopted is brought as the key aspect for sustenance of such efforts in this paper. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Investigation of Field Plate Misalignment on Electrical Characteristics of AlGaN/ GaN HEMT
dc:creator: Sehra K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Simulation based comprehensive analysis of aigan/GaN Field Plate HEMT has been reported in this paper. The impact of doping levels of GaN cap layer (either p-type or n-type) and lateral misalignment of field plate and its effect on device performance like off-state breakdown voltage, I                             <sub>ON</sub>                             /I                             <sub>OFF</sub>                             ratio, transconductance and cut-off frequency has been presented. Improvement in off-state breakdown voltage has been seen from the device having thicker channel with n-cap doping and negative FP misalignment length. Enhancement in n-cap doping also results in the improvement in breakdown voltage. However reverse effect has been observed with p-cap layer. Irrespective of poor off-state breakdown voltage, higher I                             <sub>on</sub>                             /I                             <sub>off</sub>                             ratio, lower sub-threshold slope and better transconductance can be achieved with FP-AIGaN/GaN having thinner channel HEMT. But the cut-off frequency deteriorates with reduction in channel thickness at lower gate voltage (-5V). Lateral FP misalignment and cap layer type and doping has marginal influence on gate to source capacitance. ATLAS Silvaco software has been used to investigate various performance of the device at room temperature.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Novel Combined Coordination of Distance and Overcurrent Relay for a Radial Distribution System
dc:creator: Singh D.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: This paper proposes a novel scheme for the combined coordination of distance relay (DR) and overcurrent relay (OCR), for the protection of a distribution network, as combined coordination of DR and OCRs can give superior protection. In this proposed scheme, all types of distribution network faults are detected and isolated with a suitable optimal coordination time interval (CTI). The proposed method is tested on IEEE 6-Bus radial distribution system (RDS). The fault analysis results show the current, voltage and impedance waveforms. New operating characteristics is experimented for DR, and parameters are analyzed with respect to a trip signal, resulting in a suitable range of CTI. The results indicate that the proposed combined relay coordination scheme is capable of providing reliable time margin between DR and OCRs. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: STAP Based Detector for Multi-Dynamic Radar in Homogeneous Clutter Scenario
dc:creator: Qumar J.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Defence Research and Development Organisation India

abstract: Multi-Static-Radar (MSR) systems are emerging technology due to exploitation of spatial diversity nature, offering improved Performance for various configuration of deployment of vis a vis mono-static radar. The deployment challenges becomes more difficult when all radar are considered as airborne radar and creates scenario of Multi-Dynamic radar(MDR). The radar signal characteristics for MDR scenario dynamically changing based on geometrical configuration. The Transmit and Receive pairs in MDR case is considered on moving airborne-platform such that Airborne radar with multiple receiver(Rx) mounted on different Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), such configuration considered as Multi-dynamic radar for airborne surveillance systems. Space Time Adaptive Processing(STAP) is considered as multi-dimensional adaptive-filtering algorithms that simultaneously combine and process the signals received from the array elements (spatial domain) and multiple pulses (Temporal domain) of coherent radar waveform to suppress the interference. STAP for multi-dynamic radar scenario improve detection of stealth or low rcs targets obscured by mainlobe clutter and jamming environments as detection performance depends on Receivers coordinated network. A typical interference scenario involves the detection of a low rcs targets(SNR) in the presence of a large interfering signal, it is desirable to attenuate the interfering signal while preserving the integrity of low rcs target and an appropriate dynamic range. This paper discusses the reduced rank algorithm to reduce the rank of sample covariance matrix in sample starved homogeneous environment. The two solutions namely, multi-stage Weiner filter and Principal Component (PC) have been shown. Keywords: Bi-static Radar, Multi-dynamic Radar, Multi-static Radar, STAP, clutter, jammer, MWF, PC. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Semi-Automated System Based Defect Detection in Software Requirements Specification document
dc:creator: Vaish N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: GCRG Memorial Trust Group of Institutions

abstract: Software Requirement Specification is a document that defines capabilities of any software. Requirement phase plays an important role and it is the most critical phase among all SDLC phases as requirements about any software should be mentioned properly otherwise it will lead to incorrect product. Software requirement specification document consists of defects due to this and defects are need to be detected to save time and money. There are some reading techniques with the help of which defects can be identified. There are certain types of defects definitions on which basis defects are categorized accordingly. Previously defects are identified manually by reading document but this work is based on detecting defects semi-automatically which help in improvement of quality of document as well as developed software. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Energy-efficient Aggregation-aware IEEE 802.15.4 MAC Protocol for Railway, Tele-medicine Industrial Applications
dc:creator: Tolani M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad

abstract: IEEE 802.15.4 MAC protocol utilizes superframe structure for the data transmission in an energy-efficient manner. In industrial applications, data generation rate of sensor nodes is abrupt in nature. Due to which, buffer overflow is started in few of the sensor nodes and hence overall throughput decreases. A new algorithm has been proposed in the present work for IEEE 802.15.4 standard MAC protocol to handle abrupt data generation rate efficiently and to avoid buffer overflow. Proposed algorithm utilizes K-means based aggregation function to halt buffer overflow. Simulation results indicate that the proposed algorithm beats the standard IEEE 802.15.4 MAC protocol in terms of percentage throughput and energy consumption with low mean square error (MSE). © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Droop Design Methodology for Proportional Power Balancing in VSC MTDC Systems
dc:creator: Yadav O.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: In multi-terminal DC grid droop control is commonly used to regulate the DC voltage. Generally, droop parameters are selected on the basis of steady-state analyses. This paper presents a methodology to design the droop value based on the concept that voltage response time depends on converter end capacitors and the number of terminals responsible for controlling the DC voltage. The effect of proposed droop is investigated on number of droop controlled terminals in use. A five terminal HVDC system is considered to demonstrate the efficacy of the proposed methodology. The said system is analysed for both ideal and non-ideal DC grid. The study shows that with proposed droop, converters can be utilised to their maximum limit. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Control of Grid Fed PV Generation using IIR Peak Filter in Distribution System
dc:creator: Singh B.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper provides a control structure for a grid fed single stage photovoltaic (PV) array system. The PV array is utilized at maximum power through maximum power point tracking (MPPT) technique namely perturb and observe (PO) algorithm. The solar array is used to feed to the grid via a voltage source converter (VSC) for transfer of power to the grid and the load in a distribution system. In addition, it also provides compensation of reactive power and elimination of harmonics. With the utilization of proportional integral (PI) control, the voltage level across the DC link of VSC is sustained at the reference voltage obtained from the MPPT. A digital infinite impulse response (IIR) peak filter is used for control of VSC by the extraction of load current fundamental component and generation of switching pulses of VSC. A feed-forward PV power term is incorporated for improvement of dynamic behavior of the system. A prototype of the system is developed in the laboratory and its performance is studied for varying load and solar insolation conditions. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Forecasting of Solar Radiation in India Using Various ANN Models
dc:creator: Srivastava R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Solar Radiation Forecasting plays a very important role for integration of solar power plant with conventional power plant. As it can predict how much power can be generated by any solar powered plant in next few days. For short time load management few day-a-head forecasting is required. In this paper, 6-day-a-head solar radiation forecasting has been done using various multivariate ANN models.
