For this, Feed forward Neural Network, Back Propagation Neural Network, Deep Learning Neural Network and Model Averaged Neural Network have been compared on the basis of various Statistical Indicators. One year data has been used for this analysis which has been collected from Solar Radiation Resource setup in Gorakhpur, India. Nine parameters namely Time, Average Temperature, Minimum Temperature, Maximum Temperature, Rain, Wind, Dew, Atmospheric and Azimuth have been selected as input variable to ANN. To accurately examine the models, models have been applied for January to December month forecasting. From the results, it has been found that Model Averaged Neural Network presents best results whereas Back Propagation Neural Network presents worst results. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Active Reflexology Actuation and Pressure Mapping Footwear
dc:creator: Gupta S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: SRM Institute of Science and Technology

abstract: Due to the present day to day life, it becomes difficult to maintain a healthy lifestyle. Hence, it results in a lack of proper blood flow to various parts of the body. Acupuncture was a technique used by the Chinese to improve health conditions which were based on scientific methods. Improper walking patterns may result in poorer health conditions and as mentioned above, improper blood flow to various parts of the body. Long duration walking and standing can result in hypoxia which refers to the low level of oxygen at various parts of the body. Active reflexology Actuating and footwear mapping allow to monitor and regulate health in a smarter way. It provides a solution for optimized blood flow by using the technique of acupuncture. Optimizing the blood flow in real time will result in the more practical exploration and understanding of the blood circulation pattern in the human body. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: The Load Balancing of Optimizing LEACH Clustering Algorithm with Mobile Sink and Rendezvous Nodes
dc:creator: Kumar S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: This paper proposes a load balancing technique in optimizing LEACH clustering algorithm with mobile sink and Rendezvous nodes (RNs). The proposed paper focuses on network reliability, stability, lifetime and synchronous consumption of energy in the network. In this approach, the nodes which are outside the rendezvous region follow the clustering phenomenon. On the other hand, some nodes inside the rendezvous region are selected as RNs which are closest to their cluster heads and rest are treated as normal nodes which can transmit its data directly to the mobile sink. The simulation results verified that the performance of the proposed scheme is better than the optimizing LEACH. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Design of Dual Core Photonic Crystal Fiber (DC-PCF) Based Temperature Sensor with Rectangular Lattice Structure
dc:creator: Singh A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In this paper, a temperature sensor which is based on dual-core photonic crystal fiber (DC-PCF) with rectangular air-hole lattice structure is proposed. The two fiber cores of the PCF are separated by single air hole and the background material is taken as silica whose refractive index is 1.45. The temperature sensitivity can be achieved 0.905 nm/°C for the sensing range from 0 to 1000°C. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Optimization of Capacity Allocation Problem in 4G LTE Mobile Networks
dc:creator: Krishnamurthi R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In today's information era, the mobile communication has outperformed as one of the leading technology for information exchange. It is highly possible, by mobile networks to provide any time and any where communication strategy, which meets the user requirements. However, the rising demand for multimedia, interactive and high quality of services on mobile network platform has made the existing mobile technologies to be reconsidered and reengineered. The 4G technology is one such platform that addresses the challenges in conventional mobile communication network. In this regard, 4G Long Term Evolution (4G -LTE) has promised to be effective solution to meet the future challenge of dynamism in all dimension of mobile communication. This work primarily focuses on reviewing the LTE mobile technology, the various challenges in designing LTE network and the issues in LTE while performing intended operations. Specifically, in LTE network design, the optimization of capacity allocation in LTE backhaul network is one of the most challenging issues due to high dynamic nature of mobile network communications and components. Such optimization problems are hard to solve in polynomial time. Next, this work addresses the reduction of LTE capacity allocation problem as NP complete using subset sum problem. Further, adaptive iterative local search algorithm is proposed to solve this problem. The experimental results exhibited the efficiency of proposed algorithm as 67% improvement in computation time in comparison of greedy method. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Leaky-Wave Antenna with Improved Directivity and Scanning Range
dc:creator: Tiwari A.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad

abstract: A new periodic leaky-wave antenna with high directivity and wide scanning range is proposed. The conventional series-fed patch array (SFPA) has limited scanning range and directivity due to low radiation capability of the rectangular patch i.e. unit cell. In this work, the leaky band performance of the unit cell has been improved by truncating the edge of the rectangular patch and loading of balanced shorting pins. The proposed antenna is a series-fed 8 unit cell structure. The antenna has a wide leaky band of 57 % from 10 GHz to 18 GHz with center frequency 14 GHz and the maximum simulated directivity of 19 dBi. It shows forward, broadside and backward scanning capability with a scanning range of 91□ (from +66□ to -25□). Thus the proposed unit cell structure can be effective to reduce the required antenna array length for high directivity. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Partial Discharge Analysis in Time and Time-Frequency Domain of Solid Dielectric in Power Transformer
dc:creator: Bhatt S.M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Marwadi Education Foundation's Group of Institutions

abstract: Power transformers are usually very expensive and bulky therefore their diagnosis and monitoring systems will be valuable for preventing damages. Partial Discharge (PD) is one of the phenomena that occur in the insulators and gaps between the windings of the power transformer that may be harmful for its health. In this study, a simulation model of an insulator, i.e. epoxy resin, defected with a cylindrical void is taken to generate PD activity and its analysis. Under the analysis PD waveform, PD pulses with higher magnitudes are identified and their characteristics in time and time-frequency transformed domain are studied. Some of the features are amplitude, occurrence, frequency distribution, intensity of the frequencies, etc. PD waveforms are obtained and studied on different supply voltages and different void size. Time domain feature are computed directly from the samples of the PD waveform and Time-Frequency analysis is performed by applying Short Time Fourier Transform. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance Analysis of Dual Branch MRC Diversity over Non-identical Mixture of Gamma Distribution
dc:creator: Chauhan P.S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Govind Ballabh Pant Institute of Engineering & Technology, Pauri Garhwal
M. M. M. University of Technology

abstract: In this work, dual branch maximal ratio combining (MRC) diversity analysis of generic composite distributions using mixture gamma (MG) fading model has been investigated and analyzed in terms of the probability density function (PDF), the outage probability, the amount of fading (AOF), and the moment generating function (MGF). First, we drive the PDF expression for sum of two MG random variables (RVs). Further, the results were extended to evaluate various performance metrics of the wireless system. The proposed solutions were generic and valid for entire range of fading parameters. The accuracy of the proposed solutions has been corroborated by comparing them with Monte-Carlo simulation. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Reliable and Economy Modes of Operation for Electric Vehicle-to-Home (V2H) System
dc:creator: Shemami M.S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In developing countries load shedding for hours is very common. Generally, a small power backup source is utilized for necessary loads (emergency lights and emergency loads like fan and small cooler). Nowadays, grid-connected solar inverters that installed on the roof are widely utilized for backup power source in urban cities. Penetration of electric vehicles (EVs) are increasing, so charging of EVs battery through grid increase power grid instability. Solar PV based charging of EVs can be a solution for this problem. However, in the case of a charged battery condition, whenever battery has charged through the grid, the available power from solar PV modules remain unutilized and wasted. The proposed controllers modify the regular, low-cost home inverter into a PV grid-connected inverter that it also has the ability to utilize EV battery energy. It has better control strategy that guarantees the reliability of the power supply. Economy mode and reliable mode has been developed to improve standby power supply, it also maximizes utilization of PV energy. In addition, the customers, don't need to buy a new expensive solar grid-connected inverter or any other devices to charge the EV battery if they already have a home-based inverter. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Desight and Analysis of SPV array fed Water Pumping System using BLDC motor with different Converter Topologies
dc:creator: Mishra S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Kamla Nehru Institute of Technology, Sultanpur

abstract: This paper is based on Solar Power fed Water Pumping System. The dc-dc conversion stage is facilitated through three converters viz. Landsman converter, Luo converter and Zeta converter one by one and their performances are compared for pumping system application. Soft starting of the BLDC motor is attained by gating the switch of the converter through the direct duty ratio control scheme of incremental conductance maximum power point tracking (INC-MPPT) algorithm in each case. The paper tackles the steady state and dynamic performances and inspects the potency of the BLDC motor with these converters for solar power based water pumping. The method is specifically designed for rural areas as it is simple, cost efficient and requires less maintenance. Simulated results extracted from MATLAB/Simulink prove the effectiveness of the same. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance analysis of n-channel MoS2 FET with variation of oxide thickness and channel length
dc:creator: Singh P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In this study, we have performed simulation of a nanoscale FET with reduced off state current (Io                             <sub>FF</sub>                             ) and to achieve better drain current (I                             <sub>D</sub>                             ) by reducing the oxide thickness (t                             <sub>ox</sub>                             ) and channel length (L) of the FET. The Mos2transition metal dichalcogenides has been used as a channel material for the field effect transistor (TMDFET). This paper present the oxide thickness and channel length variation of the Mos2based TMDFET to calculate the transfer(input) and output characteristics using the non-equilibrium greens function (NEGF) by solving the poison's equation. The mixed oxide materials (SiO                             <sub>2</sub>                             /HfO                             <sub>2</sub>                             ) have been used for dielectric region. The off state current calculation (Io                             <sub>FF</sub>                             ) has been performed at the V                             <sub>GS</sub>                             =0V by keeping the V                             <sub>DS</sub>                             =0.5V and also calculated the drain current at different values of V                              <sub>GS</sub>                             for decreasing channel length and oxide thickness in nanoscale range. It has been observed that at 1nm oxide thickness, the Io                             <sub>FF</sub>                             current has the minimum value at the channel length of 5nm. On the other side, for higher channel length, the I                             <sub>OFF</sub>                             current also reduces at oxide thickness of 1nm but device channel length get increased. If the oxide thickness has been taken 3.5nm, the I                             <sub>OFF</sub>                             current increases at 5nm channel length, which is not desirable for the nanoscale devices.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Organic Humidity Sensors with Different Materials and Its Application in Environment Monitoring
dc:creator: Dubey C.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: The paper reviews humidity sensors based on different organic semiconducting materials including phthalocyanines, organic conductive polymers and DPP. Subsequently, it also discusses different organic sensitive materials for substrates and electrodes that are very useful for humidity sensors. The encouragement of using organic materials for humidity sensor is because of their easier deposition, their modifiability and overall low cost. Sensor performance depends on response time, recovery time, sensitivity, selectivity and stability, therefore, these parameters are deeply discussed in this paper. Additionally, based on these performance parameters comparisons of organic humidity sensor materials, their electrical properties such as response time, sensitivity, detection range with respect to change in relative humidity are elaborated in-depth. Moreover, different organic materials used in humidity sensors and their effect on electrical properties are summarized. In the field of research and development, humidity sensors are used for a wide variety of applications including semiconductor industry, medical applications, textile production, food processing and agriculture significantly. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Android-based Text Reader for Partial Vision Impairment
dc:creator: Dhar R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The integration of hardware devices in smart-phones has outperformed the functionality of traditional phones largely. Assistive technologies like text detection and translation are some of the promising applications that emerge as the smart devices gain wide usage. In spite of recent progress in text to speech translation, natural language processing, speech recognition etc. text reading for partially impaired vision remains challenging. In this paper, we present a new Android-based Text Reader application/system that assists partially sighted and elderly people to understand the meaning of the object particularly text presented to them in any formats. This paper presents an application that assists people with partial vision to identify and recognize the surrounding text through a user-friendly interface and helps them to develop a sense of awareness about the environment. Experiments are conducted to prove the efficacy and performance of the proposed system. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Recognition of Bangla Handwritten Characters using Feature Combinations
dc:creator: Begum H.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The success of any character recognition system largely depends on how well the distinguishing features of different characters describe the classes of characters. This paper studies the effect of the combinations of three different feature sets (i.e. chain code histogram (CH), longest run (LR) and Gabor wavelet based (GW) feature) on Bangla handwritten character recognition in order to maximize the number of discriminative features among different character classes. Different combinations of the three feature sets, namely LR GW, CH GW, LR CH, and LR, CH GW tested on a standard database of Bangla characters revealed that the combination of LR and CH features yielded better recognition accuracy compared to the other cases. It was also observed that size of the feature vectors in the combination played a key role in the recognition process. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Decentralized SoC based Droop with Sliding Mode Current Controller for DC Microgrid
dc:creator: Kumari S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper presents a decentralized operation of DC microgrid comprising photovoltaic system (PV) along with parallel connected battery energy storages. The adaptive state of charge (SoC) based dc power droop is proposed for load sharing among multiple battery energy storage systems (BES). The proposed SoC adaptive droop not only ensures decentralized load sharing but also ensures optimum utilization of battery power and its charging/discharging rates which depends on its present SoC status. Also, integral sliding mode control (SMC) based robust inner current controller for bidirectional de-de converter of BES is presented to track the current references with zero steady state error and with reduced effect of load disturbances. The simulation results present the operation of adaptive SoC droop controlled DC microgrid under load dominating and generation dominating modes with reduced steady state error due to SM C based current controller and improved BES charze/discharae profile. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Rectangular Monopole Patch Antenna for C-band and X-band Applications
dc:creator: Singh M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: The paper consist of a compact monopole patch antenna designed for C-band, H-band and X-band, the proposed antenna stays designed on FR4 material substrate with ϵr = 4.4 and 0.0025 as loss tangent. In the proposed design of patch antenna the corresponding alterations had been made which contains inset and offset feeding, adding SRR shaped and rectangular shaped slots in patch and a rectangular notch in patch itself to expand the bandwidth and the defected ground plane has been used also in the design. The dimensions of the antenna is 12×18×1.6 mm width, length and height respectively. The results simulated on HFSS software for the proposed design of antenna shows bandwidth (well-defined by -10 dB return loss) from 5.5-12.5GHz, also the bandwidth is described by the value of VSWR less than 2 for whole bandwidth of antenna and the peak gain is found to be 6.25 dB. The antenna covers all of the C-band, H-band and X-band range. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Effect of Ionizing Radiation and Temperature on SiGe HBT
dc:creator: Verma Y.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology
Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: In this brief, a thorough investigation is performed to analyze the effect of ionizing radiation and temperature on SiGe HBT. The effect of 1 Mrad (Si) gamma total dose is analyzed on device performance parameters: base transit time, cut-off frequency, and maximum oscillation frequency. Also, the effects of both intrinsic and extrinsic reliability issues i.e., radiation rich environment, temperature, and self heating are analyzed on SiGe HBT and SiGe BiCMOS HBT using TCAD. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Neural Network Based Classification of Virtual Machines in IaaS
dc:creator: Patel E.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Machine Learning algorithms are being widely used to make intelligent systems. In Cloud Computing, issues like server consolidation, load balancing and virtual machine to physical machine mapping have been addressed using clustering analysis which is unsupervised learning. It is important that Cloud Service Providers address these challenges in order to provide enhanced user experience and superlative Quality of Service. Neural Networks, which fall under supervised learning algorithms, have emerged tremendously and are used in different areas such as Bio-Informatics, Pattern Recognition and Classification. Using Neural Networks and Back Propagation Algorithm, this work classifies different types of virtual machines that are providing heterogeneous services. Further, the technique is compared to K-means Clustering Algorithm which groups similar types of virtual machines into several clusters. The objective of this work is to form labeled clusters of virtual machines with the help of Neural Networks based on their types and loads and perform server consolidation. The proposed work achieves higher performance in terms of number of virtual machine samples correctly classified, as compared to K-Means Clustering algorithm. Migrating dissimilar virtual machines onto a single physical host improved machine utilization with the trade-off of slight increase in response time of the machines. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance Evaluation of Joint Filtering and Histogram Equalization Techniques for Retinal Fundus Image Enhancement
dc:creator: Kumar S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Fundus retinal images regularly experience the ill effects of non-uniform light, poor contrast and noise. This demands implementation of suitable pre-processing techniques for enhancing the image quality. Pre-processing technique includes methods of noise removal as well as contrast enhancement. Fundus images often altered by impulse noise. Meanwhile, quality of retinal fundus image suffers due to nonuniform illumination and low contrast due to anatomy of eye fundus. This paper presents the performance evaluation of joint noise filtering and histogram equalization techniques for the overall quality enhancement of retinal fundus image. In the first stage of the work, two emerging noise-filtering methods namely, NAFSM filter and block-matching and 3D filtering (BM3D) techniques are implemented for de-noising. In second stage, histogram equalization (HE), adaptive histogram equalization (ADHE), contrast limited adaptive histogram equalization (CLAHE), exposure based sub-image histogram equalization (ESIHE) techniques are investigated one by one for obtaining the best suited combination of the filtering and HE methods for the improvement of retinal fundus picture. Performance evaluation of these techniques have been carried out by determining the performance parameters such as histogram, SNR, entropy, absolute mean brightness error and peak signal-to-noise ratio (PSNR) of processed retinal fundus images. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Analysis of Sinusoidal PWM and Space Vector PWM based diode clamped multilevel inverter
dc:creator: Sharma A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology

abstract: In today's world, when there is crisis of conventional energy resources, it has become essential to harness energy from non-conventional energy resources. However, the electrical energy obtained through renewable sources is mostly variable or in the form of direct current. The output voltage obtained from solar or wind needs to be converted through either ac-dc-ac or dc-ac converters. The utility grid compatible ac output from these sources can only be applied to home appliances and electrical drives. Thus, an inverter is an indispensable device in the present energy scenario. In the design of inverter, gate pulse generation plays a vital role. There are several techniques available to generate gate pulses. Some of the techniques are space vector modulation (SVM) and sinusoidal pulse width modulation (SPWM) which could be used not only for two-level inverters but multilevel inverters as well. Because of ease, a two-level inverter is used for low voltage and low power application whereas, for high voltage and high-power applications, multilevel inverters are best suited. In this paper, an attempt is made to bring out a comparison of the performances of two-level and three-level inverters based on SPWM and SVPWM techniques for linear and non-linear loads based on MATBAB R2016a simulation. The results obtained are presented. The results indicate that the inverter with SVPWM technique performs better than the one with SPWM technique as the former generates less total harmonic distortion (THD) compared to latter for the same load parameters. Also, it is seen that the non-linearity in the load has its effect on the harmonics. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Experimental Analysis of Electro- Thermal Contact Resistance of Al and Cu Surfaces
dc:creator: Pandey N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Present research work is focused to develop a methodology to predict real contact area and interface temperature for various type of metal surfaces with respect to applied force and surface roughness. Electro-Thermal characterization for aluminum and copper samples are performed experimentally to understand the electrical contact phenomenon, happening at macroscopic level, at the interface. Dependence of electrical contact resistance and temperature on surface roughness and contact load are analyzed using DOE. FEM analysis is performed using COMSOL™, as a simulation tool, for validation of interface temperature. Electrical Constriction conductance, obtained from FEM analysis, predicted actual contact area for low voltage electrical connectors. Moreover, empirical relations are developed in Minitab™ to calculate the mechanical contact area and interface temperature based on given load, average surface roughness of the interface and electrical contact resistance. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance Estimation of Permanent Magnet Synchronous Generator Based Wind Energy Conversion System
dc:creator: Srivastava P.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Wind energy has established as fastest growing renewable energy technology. During last few decades world has witnessed multidimensional development in this area and made this technology acceptable for efficient production of bulk power. Recent research articles and renewable energy market trends have demonstrated the popularity of permanent magnet synchronous generator (PMSG) based wind energy conversion system (WECS) for such requirements. Objective of present work is to examine the performance of the cylindrical pole PMSG based wind turbine (WT) interfaced to the grid via back-to-back voltage source converter. Present work focuses on generator performance with zero d-axis current control (ZDC) and maximum torque per ampere control (MTPA), it has been observed that cylindrical rotor PMSG displays identical performance with ZDC and MTPA control. In order to analyze the WECS performance, simulation is done in MATLAB/Simulink platform. Excellent performance is observed and is validated with the obtained performance parameters for the system at steady state. The WECS performance is studied in maximum power point tracking (MPPT) range only. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Analysis. Modelling and Design of Resonant Dual Active Bridge Isolated Bidirectional dc/dc Converter for Minimizing Cold Start Effect of Fuel Cell Vehicle
dc:creator: Bandi M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Effect of air and sound pollution has been increases since last few decades due to internal combustion engines and there is a lesser impact of electrical apparatus in automobile sector. Moreover, conventional energy sources are faster exhaustion sources and have been severe impact over ozone layer. The usage of electrical components is increases exponentially in electric vehicles over last decade due to advances in power electronics. In this article, performance comparison of bi-directional dc/dc converters over switching loss reduction, efficiency, ripple analysis, cost and size. Those dc/dc converters are Generic Duel Active Bridge (GDAB-IBDC) and Resonant Dual Active Bridge (RDAB-IBDC) isolated bidirectional dc/dc converters. The GDAB-IBDC converter is simple and its controller is not complex compare to resonant dc/dc converter. The simulation is carried out over PSCAD software with 10 ohm constant resistive load. The resonant dc/dc converter has excellent features compare to generic dc/dc converter like higher switching frequency, less switching losses, higher efficiency, more possibility of soft switching of both bridges and lesser circulating current. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Tapped-inductor Quasi-z-source Based PWM Dc-dc Converter
dc:creator: Patidar K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper presents a tapped-inductor based step-up PWM DC-DC converter. The converter is based upon well-known quasi-z-source inverter topology. The proposed converter can provide high voltage gain without operating at higher duty ratio. The operating principle, steady state analysis in continuous conduction mode and boundary operating condition are presented. The converter analysis with nonidealities is also conducted. The expressions for output voltage and efficiency are derived with considering non-idealities in converter. The effect of load resistance on gain and efficiency is evaluated. A low power level prototype is prepared to verify analytical and simulation results. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Recognition of Handwritten Numerals of various Indian Regional Languages using Deep Learning
dc:creator: Chaurasia S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Handwritten numeral recognition is an interesting area of research in the field of computer vision and pattern recognition. It plays an important role in postal automation services especially in a country like India where multiple languages and scripts are used. So, the recognition system needs to deal with many challenges like varying writing styles and cursive nature of handwriting. This paper proposes an effective handwritten numeral recognition approach based on Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) and Support Vector Machine (SVM). The proposed work is an attempt to develop a recognition system for recognizing the handwritten digits written in any one of the regional languages: Bangla, Devanagari, Oriya, and Telugu. The proposed system first normalizes the input image having single digit thereafter CNN works as a feature extractor while SVM as a classifier. Experiments have been conducted on benchmark database of ISI Kolkata (having numerals of Bangla, Devanagari, and Oriya languages) and CMaterdb (having numerals of Telugu language) (Jadavpur University). The results show that our model performs best for Devanagari language with accuracy 99.41% and for Bangla, Telugu, and Oriya, the accuracies are 99.14%, 99.16%, and 94.54% respectively. So, the performance of the proposed approach is better than state-of-art approaches. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: (UPCON) A novel distributed T-equivalent circuit model of a microstrip interdigital capacitor
dc:creator: Talluri S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Jaypee University of Information Technology, Solan

abstract: The theme of this paper is to present a distributed T-equivalent circuit model of a microstrip interdigital capacitor. The distributed model has been considered in order to characterize the interdigital capacitor more accurately over wideband of frequencies. Three interdigital capacitors with different number of fingers have been analyzed. From the analysis and observations made from analysis, a generalized distributed T -equivalent circuit model, similar to that of a distributed T -equivalent model for a conventional transmission line, has been presented. A comparison is made between the lumped and distributed equivalent circuit model to present the advantage of the distributed model. This new distributed model can be used in the analysis and design of wideband circuits that uses the interdigitalcapacitors. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Crosstalk in Dynamic WDM System Employing EDFA
dc:creator: Singh A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: K J Somaiya Institute of Technology
Indian Institute of Technology (Indian School of Mines), Dhanbad

abstract: Crosstalk due to nonlinear effects such as Stimulated Raman Scattering and Cross Phase Modulation in dynamic WDM systems employing lumped amplifier is investigated using closed formed formulae. Effect of change in pump power, interchannel separation is also investigated and found to be detrimental. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Measuring the Fault Predictability of Software using Deep Learning Techniques with Software Metrics
dc:creator: Bhandari G.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Minimization of failures is the major expectation from reliable software. Predicting the software faults supports in identifying the location in the faulty modules for detailed testing to increase the maintainability. This paper presents fault prediction using some of the deep learning techniques utilizing source code metrics of the software. Accuracy, f-measure, recall, precision, receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curves and area under curve (AUC) values are considered to measure the performance of the deep learning methods. Experimental analysis on five NASA public benchmarked datasets depict Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) classifier as a more robust software fault prediction model achieving the highest accuracy rates. CNN is followed by Artificial Neural Network (ANN) and then Self-Organizing Map (SOM). Learning Vector Quantization (LVQ) version 3 and MultiLVQ have the worst performance on software fault prediction using software metrics. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Impact of Symmetric Double Material Gate Oxide on Analog and RF Performance of FDSOI MOSFET
dc:creator: Gupta A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In this work, we investigates the DC, analog and RF characteristics of symmetric double material gate oxide fully depleted silicon-on insulator (FDSOI) MOSFET. The main aim is to increase the drain current, I                             <sub>ON</sub>                             /I                             <sub>OFF,</sub>                             transconductance (g                             <sub>m</sub>                             ), cut-off frequency (f                             <sub>T</sub>                             ), transconductance frequency product (TFP) of the proposed designed device used for high frequency applications. In the proposed device, heterogeneous dielectric with Si3N4 at source side and HfO                             <sub>2</sub>                              at drain side is used as gate oxide. In such a device it is observed that ON state drive current is larger whereas leakage current is smaller as compared to the conventional FDSOI MOSFET. It has also been observed that when SiO                             <sub>2</sub>                              is replaced by heterogeneous dielectric then its various Figure of Merits (FOMs) gets improved. The result has been simulated using Silvaco TCAD tool.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: K-NN and LDA based Motor Imagery EEG Classification using Phase Features
dc:creator: Bhatnagar M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: A Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) based on motor imagery (MI) can be developed to translate the motor intent of a person for controlling some device. For this purpose, changes occurring in alpha and beta bands are exploited. In this paper we utilize measurement of coherence and phase synchrony (Phase features) to inspect the activities of sensory motor cortex during imagination of hand and feet movement. An attempt is made to establish relationship between changes occurring in the motor cortex with respect to phase. After bandpass filtering and spatial filtering for noise removal analysis of phase characteristics of these signals is carried out. These features are classified with the help of Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) and k-Nearest Neighbor (k-NN) classifiers. The classification performance suggests that phase and coherence features prove to be an additional set of features for differentiating between various motor imagery signals. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: QOS Improvement in MANET Routing by Route Optimization through Convergence of Mobile Agent
dc:creator: Verma V.R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: A, Mobile ad-hoc network (MANET) is collection of mobile devices that desire to communicate in the lack of any fixed infrastructure so, in this environment every mobile nodes works as a router in itself. In this type of wireless network, any node can leave or join network at any movement. Besides it this type of networks have some other challenging characteristics as regularly changing topology, high mobility, narrow bandwidth. Conventional routing protocols focused on finding shortest path rather than Quality of Service path. Link breakage is the main reason of high mobility as well as lack of energy of wireless nodes. In the lack of resources, traffic density leads to congestion. So, the performance of routing protocol degrades in this type of networks. But it is not so easy task to take multiple QoS parameters for finding optimal route. Mobile software agent technology with unique features like mobility, autonomous, intelligent and adaptability can solve this problem. This research paper focuses on designing routing model using mobile agent paradigm. The proposed model attempts to find more optimal path by considering multiple QoS parameters like stability, delay, congestion and energy of the node. Simulation is done using Matlab simulator the simulation output shows that our proposed model is more reliable than traditional hop by hop AODV for finding the route from source node to destination node. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Impact of donor-layer doping thickness, gate-length and temperature on potential and electron concentration in AlGaN/GaN Double-Heterostructure and Single-Heterostructure HEMT
dc:creator: Chugh N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper presents a comparative simulation based analysis of the impact of donor-layer doping thickness, gate-length and temperature on channel potential and electron concentration of Al                             <sub>0.25</sub>                             Ga                             <sub>0.75</sub>                             N/GaN/Al                             <sub>0.2</sub>                             5Ga                             <sub>0.75</sub>                             N double heterostructure (DH) HEMT and Al                             <sub>0.25</sub>                             Ga                             <sub>0.75</sub>                             N/GaN single-heterostructure (SH) HEMT. Due to the formation of two 2-DEGs at the two hetero-Interfaces, potential and electron concentration of a double-heterostructure HEMT is found to be more sensitive to variation in gate-length, donor-layer doping, donor-layer thickness and temperature as compared to SH-HEMT.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Design and Simulation of Smart Prepaid-Postpaid Energy Meter with Alarm and Theft Control
dc:creator: Ask K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: This paper proposes a mathematical model of multi-featured prepaid-postpaid energy meter. These features are (a) automatic billing, (b) prepaid collection, (c) choice of prepaid or postpaid, (d) detection of abnormal operational condition, (e) protection against electricity theft, (f) data sharing between consumer and utility end, (g) improved accuracy, (h) user friendly as well as economical and (i) motivating towards electric energy conservation. The model uses RS-232 and GSM module for two-way communication. The proposed model is simulated and tested over MATLAB/ Simulink                             <sup>®</sup>                             platform. The results obtained are promising and complying with the existing features of the energy meter.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A memory based meta-heuristic optimizer for optimal VAr management in power transmission system
dc:creator: Karmakar N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Indian Institute of Technology (Indian School of Mines), Dhanbad

abstract: Reactive power management (RPM) of a power system is a special kind of optimal power flow for minimizing the system operating cost along with minimization of system active power loss and the generation of reactive power from all VAr sources. An evolutionary algorithm, inspired from intelligence of crow, named as Crow search algorithm (CSA) is implemented to achieve the optimal control parameter settings for optimal power flow in a existing power network. It is validated that CSA may promote to gain satisfactory outcomes compared to the other centralized technique: Particle swarm optimization (PSO) with promising convergence characteristics. Also, a comparative analysis of active power loss and operating cost has been shown in this article. The total performance of the proposed method is demonstrated through numbered mathematical strategies on IEEE 30-bus power network. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Investigation of Planar and Double-Gate Junctionless Transistors with Non-Uniform Doping
dc:creator: Singh D.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this paper for the first time we present the comparative electrostatic behavior analysis of Junctionless Transistor (JLT) with non-uniform doping profile in the vertical direction. Two structures, planar (single gate) JLT in silicon-on-insulator (SOI) and double gate JLT (DG-JLT) are used for 2-D quantum transport simulation. Position of peak concentration of impurities has been varied across channel to get less leakage current, better sub-threshold swing. Reduced OFF current, subthreshold swing and High ON to OFF current ratio are achieved in JLT (Planar and double-gate structure) by tuning shape and peak of non-uniform doping profile. Peak concentration of impurities at the surfaces gives the better performance in terms of reduced OFF current, subthreshold swing and High ON to OFF current ratio. Moreover it is observed that multi-gate structure with nonuniform doping profile will give robust design compared to the single-gate structure with non-uniform doping profile. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance Analysis of Single and Dual Gate Vertical Channel Organic Thin Film Transistor
dc:creator: Rathi R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Graphic Era Deemed to be University

abstract: The article presented herein compares the performance for single and dual gate Vertical Channel (VC) OTFT (VOTFT) using Silvaco's 2-Dimensional numerical device simulator: The ATLAS. This tool has been used for analysis of electrical characteristics of the VOTFT and thereafter its performance parameters have been extracted. The channel of the VTOTFT dictates the thickness of the organic srmiconductor materials (OSC) and further to enhance the performance of the device the noval dual gate architecture has been proposed. This architecture is used for enhancing and boosting the performance of OTFT. The results of analysis shows that the performance of dual gate VOTFT is much enhanced and gives a higher I                             <sub>on</sub>                             / I                             <sub>off</sub>                             ratio current.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Thermodynamic Properties of LiGaS2 and LiGaSe2 using First-Principle Calculations
dc:creator: Chandra S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Indian Institute of Technology (Indian School of Mines), Dhanbad

abstract: Thermodynamic properties of LiGaS2 and LiGaSe2 semiconductors have been studied using first-principle density functional theory (DFT) calculations. Thermodynamic properties such as phonon dispersion curve, phonon density of states (DOS), Debye temperature (Θ                             <sub>D</sub>                             ) and heat capacity (C                             <sub>p</sub>                             ) have been calculated and found to be in fair agreement with the available data.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Multi Band Antenna with Multi Band Notch 2.5/3.7/6.4/8.1/12.4/14.4GHz Characteristics
dc:creator: Rao P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: M. M. M. University of Technology

abstract: In this paper an UWB antenna has been proposed. This antenna consists of a circular patch with crescent shaped slot, in which different slots has been introduced to enhance the performance and operate the antenna for the multi-band operation, also window shaped parasitic patch has been used to introduce notches at different frequency bands. Band notched characteristics of the scheduled antenna is obtained to prevent the potential interference between the ultra wideband transmission systems and the existing limited band transmission system. The scheduled antenna is fabricated on a FR-4 Epoxy substrate; and has compact size of dimensions 36 × 32 mm2. According to the measured and simulated results of scheduled antenna, antenna has impedance bandwidth of 2.3 to 15 GHz with VSWR ≤ 2. The proposed antenna is suitable for the Bluetooth (2.4GHz), WiMax(2.5/3.5GHz), WLAN(2.4/4.9/5.8-GHz, and Ku-band satellite communication. The proposed antenna has been fabricated and the measured result is found very close to simulated results. The scheduled antenna shows high impedance bandwidth, stable gain, good antenna radiation pattern and high efficiency across the entire frequency range spectrum used for suitable UWB application. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: HANKEL NORM APPROXIMATION of A HIGHLY UNSTABLE SYSTEM
dc:creator: Pandey S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: An Illustration of reduction technique of higher order model into its lower order subsystems for highly unstable NASA HIGHMAT FIGHTER using optimal Hankel Norm Approximation is explained in this paper. For higher order system a decomposition approach has been done to resolve the highly unstable system into its unstable and stable combination. Hankel Norm Approximation has been used for obtaining the stable part of reduced order model and hence the overall reduction model system has been developed by combining the both parts. One is reduced model of stable part and second one is unstable part of decomposition. A mathematical strategy of the plant had been done to demonstrate the adequacy of the technique. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Comparative Analysis of Control Schemes in Grid Connected PV System
dc:creator: Goyal R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Distributed Generation (DG) model is familiar at the distribution plane to develop the profit of the local renewable generation. To meet the requirements of grid integration and for the proper functioning of the DG system, the appropriate control topology should be enhanced to offer seamless transition, safety, protection, voltage balance and frequency stability in grid coupled and islanding approach. Islanding is a very critical and unsafe condition for the utility workers and it may prevent automatic re-connection of devices. For that DG scheme have to identify the islanding condition and must exchange to a operating mode. Here, in the grid connected mode, the controller is operating in the current control mode to offer stipulated power to the grid but its inject large harmonics component into the grid. For that, a sliding mode control scheme is implemented instead of the current control scheme and compared to check the performance of the different control scheme on mode transition and total harmonic distortion of DG unit. The grid connected PV scheme is demonstrated in the MATLAB Simulink environment. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Outcome-Based Education (OBE) Academic Planning-An Insight into All Round Development of an Engineer
dc:creator: Tiwari A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Curriculum of Engineering is the matter of concern over last few decades in India. As a large number of engineers are produced every year, but the productivity is not up to the mark. Therefore, leading to the unemployment of Engineering graduates, due to the lack of skills, interest, creativity, and hands-on-training exposure. This paper discusses in depth the challenges and improvement required in the existing curriculum of engineering to overcome the problem of unemployment in our country. Besides this, proposed syllabi of engineering also summarized in the paper to fulfill the existing gap that results in larger employment and industry-ready engineers. Additionally, it will be helpful in creating interdisciplinary co-relation between traditional and outcome-based engineering education for Indian Engineering Institutions and Universities. © 2018 IEEE.
author-keyword: Current social issues with engineering solutions

dc:title: A Dedicated CCC based Data Channel Selection Scheme with Proactive Hand-off in Cognitive Radio Network
dc:creator: Rajpoot V.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: Achievable throughput in cognitive radio-medium access control (CR-MAC) has direct impact on common control channel (CCC) design and control overhead. The CCC design decides the most efficient path to collision free data transmission for CR user. The in-band CCC design suffers with collision due to asynchronous control information transmission and multichannel hidden terminal due to clustering. To achieve global coverage dedicated out-band CCC is used but subjected to intruder attacks and saturation. In comparison with in-band, dedicate out-band overlay CCC design performs much better thus widely used in multi-channel environment. The need of common channel selection arises again whenever the primary user (PU) reappears in the channel. Spectrum hand-off is required to avoid collision between CR user and PU. To deal with the issue, the proactive switching is more favorable to reactive switching scheme. Capability of prediction of best future spectrum through past history of the channels makes network less prompt to the collision. The existing work shows that the new channel access for switching in proactive hand-off is works according to the environmental changes. The higher number of hand-offs increases packet loss which affects system performance drastically. To deal with stated issues, in the proposed work a common channel selection algorithm through transmission of PU free channel list (PCL) is developed. The history of same PCL is then used to develop a proactive hand-off scheme. The hand-off algorithm improves performance through best channel selection. It reduces the number of channel switching thus minimizing disruptions due to PU activities. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: The Challenges in Development of Internet of Things Based Smart Power Distribution System
dc:creator: Sharma D.D.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The traditional aging power grid is on the verge of revamp into the smart grid in which all stakeholders will have active participation. Internet of Things (IoT) will play a major role in the development of smart grid. The most of the countries giving thrust in incorporating the renewable generation for the purpose of getting clean energy. Mostly, the renewable generations are penetrating the low voltage side of the power system. This penetration is making the power distribution system a complex one. The power distribution system embedded with IoT can provide a solution to this complexity. But embedding the IoT into the power distribution system poses new challenges. This paper identifies these challenges in various interdisciplinary domains of the IoT power distribution system while surveying different latest literatures. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Scheme for Detection of High Transmission Power Based Wormhole Attack in WSN
dc:creator: Dwivedi R.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Wireless sensor network (WSN) is a network of sensors which are deployed in a surrounding to sense any physical phenomenon. These nodes can be deployed randomly or manually. Usually, randomized deployment is done in hard to reach territories and manual deployment is done in easy to reach areas. This emerging technology has several applications however, it also has several issues viz., power efficiency, scalability, responsiveness, reliability and security etc. Wormhole attack is one of such issues related to network security. This attack is done at network layer. There are various modes of this attack. Among these modes, wormhole attack based on high transmission power is focused in this paper. Here, we proposed a scheme for detection of this type of wormhole attack by using Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) and the results of simulation are shown with various performance metrics. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: An Analysis on Arduino based Single Axis Solar Tracker
dc:creator: Rani P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: A solar photovoltaic (SPV) cells based single axis tracking system on Arduino Uno platform is implemented in this article for achieving maximum power during a day. The key idea of this article is implementing an automatic single axis solar tracking system. Alignment of solar panel with the Sunlight for getting maximum solar radiation is experimented. This system tracks the maximum intensity of light in terms of maximum power point (MPP). When the light intensity decreases, its alignment changed automatically for catching maximum light intensity. This article shows implementation and analysis of single axis solar tracker, while various solar axis trackers are available in the market. Meanwhile, the proposed technique is able to identify axis quickly and aligned with sun rays in order to achieve MPP as the output regardless motor speed. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance Analysis of Energy Detection Based Cognitive Radio over GBK Fading Channel
dc:creator: Bhatt M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Govind Ballabh Pant Institute of Engineering & Technology, Pauri Garhwal
Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: A Generalised Bessel K fading distribution (GBK) has flexible parameters and own the capability to capture the multipath as well as shadowing effect. Moreover, it reduces to several well known multipath fading cases such as exponential distribution, generalised K distribution, generalised Gamma distribution, Half Gaussian, K distribution, Gamma distribution. In this work, our goal is to obtain analytical expression of average probability of detection (APD) in case of GBK fading channel and then to carry out the system performance analysis by applying square law selection (SLS) diversity scheme. Effect of different shaping parameters on system performance is also examined. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Thin Film Deposition and Characterization for Various Applications
dc:creator: Pandey N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Thin film in today's world found to have documented record of more than 5000 years. Investigation on thin film have directly or indirectly influence many new areas of research in solid state physics and chemistry that are based on the thickness, geometry and structure of the thin film deposited. Processing of material into thin film provide us an easy way to incorporate it into devices. This review paper discusses different thin films material in-depth, their deposition methods, characterization techniques and applications. This summarized review on chalcogenide and metal oxide thin film characterization, shall help researcher in their area of optoelectronic, photovoltaic and magnetic device fabrication and their low cost applications. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Chaos control of an extended four dimensional fundamental power system using sliding mode control
dc:creator: Kumar M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this paper, control of chaos in an extended four-dimensional fundamental power system (FDFPS) using sliding mode control (SMC) is considered. First order sliding mode control laws are derived in order to control the chaotic behaviour in FDFPS. The sufficient stability condition is devised for the designed sliding manifold based on Lyapunov stability theory. The proposed control law simplifies the controller design of power system stabilizer and provides an effective and robust control to avoid the instability in the FDFPS. Simulation is presented in MATLAB environment and reveals the effectiveness of proposed SMC scheme. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Analyses of Grid Connected Hybrid PV/Wind Renewable Power Generation System
dc:creator: Srivastava A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: The non-conventional sources of energy like wind, solar and hydro are available everywhere, environmentally friendly and free. The wind energy systems might not generally be used at all locations since of low wind speeds and are additional unpredictable than solar energy. The grouping of renewable energy sources is consequently an area of the researcher to explore and can be broadly used as another to conventional sources energy. In this paper, we initially assessment together with the wind power and photovoltaic power generation procedures and their maximum power point tracking technique. In this paper, we have to design and analyzes a hydropower generation that combination of solar and wind energy conversion techniques, © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Effect of Phase Filtering on Interferometry based Displacement Analysis of Cultural Heritage Sites
dc:creator: Tripathi A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Synthetic Aperture RADAR Remote Sensing technique has widely used in mapping and monitoring of cultural and natural heritage sites. In today's scenario, SAR Interferometry (InSAR) is being used to measure the elevation and displacement of manmade and natural features. This study was focused on phase filtering to detect displacement in cultural heritage site using space borne repeat pass SAR Interferometry. Rohtasgarh fort, was chosen as study site and Sentinel -1, C-Band interferometric pairs of March and April 2017 were used. Interferometric processing for interferogram generation, coherence and phase unwrapping was performed to generate a displacement map. It was however noticed that phase noise greatly affects and deteriorates the quality of interferogram which in turn affects the phase unwrapping and geophysical measurements such as displacement mapping. In this work, Modified Goldstein filter was used for phase noise suppression and preserving the fringe edges. Using a threshold of 0.3 for coherence, displacement map was generated, and Modified Goldstein Filtering was applied on it. Most of the areas in and around the fort showed no displacement but there was an upliftment seen at few places inside the fort with maximum value of 10mm. Subsidence with maximum value of 10mm was also seen in areas outside the fort. Upliftment could have been due to water accumulation inside the fort or dust storm while subsidence could be possible due to lose debris washed off by rain water. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Smart Home Load Manager Algorithm under Demand Response
dc:creator: Jain V.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: College of Technology and Engineering, Udaipur
Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Automation and control of residential loads are an integral part of the smart grid initiatives under advance metering infrastructure. This paper presents a new approach combining clustering and scheduling algorithms, termed as Smart Home Load Manager (SHLM), for automatic scheduling of appliances considering Demand Response (DR). The clustering algorithm automatically calculates peak consumption hours of consumer, based on previous consumptions, using load index and cluster coefficient, whereas the scheduling algorithm schedules the interruptible loads based on appliance predefined priorities. The SHLM keeps operating load below power limit, especially during utility peak hours, considering various constraints like comfort, pricing signals and power outages to minimize Peak-to- Average Ratio (PAR). In addition, deployment of the proposed approach serves as a catalyst to promote DR potentials for the benefit of both end users and utilities. The effectiveness of the proposed approach and the practical application of DR signals are demonstrated on Virginia Tech Advanced Research Institute data. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Chalcogenide glasses for sensor application: A Review
dc:creator: Mishra S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: M. M. M. University of Technology

abstract: Chalcogenide vitreous semiconductors are chemical compounds of chalcogen S, Se or Te atoms combined with some other elements of another group of the periodic table obtained with melt-quench. Chalcogenide glasses plays an important role in various technological fields where their properties are engaged in computer memories, photodetectors, telecommunications, chemical, and ionic sensors. These glasses have an excellent transmission in near and infrared spectral region. These glasses are used for preparing writing channel waveguides. A review of fabrication, structural and optical properties, applications generally for sensing is discussed in the present paper which can help the researchers to formulate their future research plan. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Optimization Framework for Flavour and Nutrition Balanced Recipe: A Data Driven Approach
dc:creator: Nirmal I.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Food has been playing a major part of human civilization as not only being a physiological need, but being a major factor for defining the culture and society. The choice of the food is mainly depended on both flavour and nutrient but the biasness towards to the flavour factor has lead the human to effect badly on their healthier lifestyle. Recipe recommendation literature typically considers either flavour or nutrient factor. Various flavour traits are also preventing the promotion of healthy foods while maintaining the palatability. Our data driven flavour and nutrient optimization framework consists of classification model which achieved 79.546 % prediction accuracy when detecting the cuisine, generalized flavour recommendation approach and personalized nutrient recommendation approach when deciding the optimization task. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Selective Sleep- awake Scheduling in WSN -Cloud Integration
dc:creator: Srivastava R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: The integration of Wireless Sensor Network (WSN) with Cloud is becoming popular in most of the industry and academics. WSN is bringing attention from past few decades as it used in many geographical area and application. The usage of WSN have several benefits such as tiny size, low power, low cost and easy communication over small range. With these benefits it has certain drawbacks like low processing power, scarcity of storage and limited battery life. The biggest constraints of WSN is low battery powered and limited processing. The idea behind the integration of WSN and CC is to overcome the certain limitation of WSN and to exploit the cloud to share and process the sensory data such as temperature, pressure, light, movement etc. as collected by WSN anytime and anywhere. The proposed model deals with environmental application where detection of forest fire is analyzed by taking parameters such as temperature, humidity, wind speed and time using fuzzy logic as by detecting earlier of fire in forest it helps to prevent huge loss of living organism, infrastructure and property. After detection the proposed MSA (Modified Sleep Awake) model work in prolonging lifetime of WSN in forest fire application using selective sleep awake approach. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Grid Connected Renewable Energy Based EV Charger with Bidirectional AC/DC Converter
dc:creator: Goud P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: The growing deployment of both renewable energy sources as well as the electrical vehicles (EV s) has changed the conventional structure of the global energy sector. In Grid connected renewable energy based EV charger systems, the bidirectional AC/DC converters are employed for more reliable power flow operation. This paper proposes a bidirectional AC/DC converter with combination of ac-dc grid bidirectional converter (GBC) and de-de bidirectional battery charger (BBC). The GBC converter facilitate the bidirectional power flow between the AC and DC grid, and BBC converter provides a bidirectional power flow between the energy storage system/EVs and the dc grid with isolation. To inject the power in to the grid a robust current control technique is required. A hysteresis based current control technique is used to inject current in to the grid. In AC-DC conversion, an asymmetric PWM strategy is proposed with minimum switching transitions. Simulations are performed using PSCAD tool to validate the proposed control algorithms. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Optimal Placement of TCSC and STATCOM for Voltage Stability Enhancement in Transmission Network
dc:creator: Rawat M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The major cause of voltage instability in a power system is due to the imbalance between reactive power demand and supply. Due to advancement in power semiconductor technology, the utilization of FACTS devices has become an efficient solution to overcome voltage instability in power system. The weak transmission lines which are prone to voltage collapse are identified using a line voltage stability index. The power blackouts arising from voltage instability can be avoided if identification of the weak area leading to voltage collapse can be identified at an early stage using voltage stability index (VSI). In this paper, a line voltage stability indicator, VSI - 2 is used to identify weak transmission lines in the system. In order to enhance the voltage stability of the system, FACTS devices, i.e., TCSC and STATCOM are placed in series and shunt with weak transmission lines. An IEEE 30 bus test system is used for validation of the proposed approach. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Folding and Register Minimization Transformation on DSP Filter
dc:creator: Joy A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Ambedkar Institute of Advanced Communication Technologies & Research

abstract: This paper presents folding transformation technique on a second order IIR filter or Biquad filter and third order IIR filter. Retiming is done prior to folding transformation. The advantages of folding are reduction in number of arithmetic circuits such as adders and multipliers, time multiplexing of numerous algorithms onto a single arithmetic circuit resulting in low silicon area for integrated circuits and can be processed on single or multiple clocks. As the number of arithmetic circuits decrease, the number of registers increases, so register minimization technique is used. This technique enables to reduce the area required by memory along with the reduction in the number of memory units. The algorithm is coded in VHDL and implemented on Xilinx Virtex7 XC7VX330T. On comparing the device utilization of the following pairs of circuits, the percentage improvement of folded DFG over filter DFG is nearly 35%, register minimized folded DFG over filter DFG is nearly 23% and register minimized folded DFG over folded DFG is nearly 16%. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Improved Widrow-Hoff Based Adaptive Control of Multi-Objective PV-DSTATCOM System
dc:creator: Modi G.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper presents a control of multi-objective solar photovoltaic-distribution static compensator (PV-DSTACOM) feeding nonlinear load connected at PCC (Point of Common Coupling). It utilizes an improved Widrow-Hoff based adaptive control algorithm to control the voltage source converter (VSC) for enhancing the power quality of the distribution system. The Widrow-Hoff method is used to revise two weights to appraise the load fundamental active component and the supply voltages. The PO algorithm is used to extract the peak power and to calculate the duty ratio of the boost converter. For fast dynamics response, the DC link voltage is held at a set value by PI controller and its output is considered as a loss component of the current, which represents the losses in the VSC. A constant learning rate is chosen for updating the weight of adaptive control, which shows the good dynamic response and the accuracy. The performance of the proposed system is validated through simulated and test results in various dynamic conditions. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Significance of Pass Transistor Logic in Organic Electronic Circuits
dc:creator: Singh Rathod A.P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Graphic Era Deemed to be University
Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In the field of renewable energy harnessing Organic electronics has opened enormous possibilities as it is more environment friendly in comparison to silicon. Moreover organic electronics provides numerous advantages like flexibility of the substrate, low cost raw material, low cost fabrication, simple fabrication steps and flexible device. These advantages open a whole new world of low cost electronics display devices and much more. But the larger size of organic transistor and moderate mobility of organic materials serves as challenge for us. But a probable solution to these problems can be found in pass transistor logic (PTL) design. Since the overall size of the circuit also depends on the number of transistors in the circuit and not merely on the size of individual circuit. Therefore by drastically reducing the transistor count in the circuit we can minimize the size of the circuit. In addition to it the propagation delay and interconnect length is also optimised by using PTL architecture along with power dissipation. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Ultra-Flat Dispersion with High Nonlinearity Hexagonal Photonic Crystal Fiber
dc:creator: Singh Yadav A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In this paper we proposed hexagonal photonic crystal fiber (H-PCF) with a periodic arrangement of air holes using the COMSOL Multiphysics software. Here we have presented the dispersion properties and the effective refractive index of the H-PCF. H-PCF achieve ultra-flat dispersion from 1.45 μm to 1.80 μm wavelengths (350 nm bandwidth) with high nonlinearity. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Design, Modelling and Implementation of an Attraction type Levitation Prototype with tilt Control
dc:creator: Kundu J.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper presents a study on the design, finite element (FE) based analysis, electromagnetic analysis, system modelling and fabrication of a large rectangular platform weighing 592 gm.
