A significant improvement has been achieved as no mechanical restrainer is being used. The prototype has been designed, mathematically modelled, analysed and experimentally investigated. Some of the objectives are to evaluate parameters, determine force, inductance and current vs. air-gap characteristics. Conventional analytical formulation and then FEM based calculations are being done. It is being levitated under four electromagnets with four independent closed-loop position feedback. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Basis for Tracking Area Reconfiguration for 5G Networks
dc:creator: Sanwal A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The enormous competition and the increasing number of user equipment (UE) in the telecommunications market has garnered attention towards the necessity of optimized and cost-efficient networks. Tracking the position of UEs while minimizing signalling cost is a key problem that needs to be solved for upcoming 5G networks. Tracking area (TA) is a term used for assemblage of cells (nodes) in long term evolution networks. Planned distribution of TAs, depending on the mobility pattern of UEs, is a technique used to optimize the signalling overhead, and plays a vital role in utilizing the resources efficiently. TAs must be reconfigured over the time intervals so as to adapt them to the variation in UE's pattern. Compared to earlier generations of cellular networks, 5G networks will have more flexible configuration of TAs as it will utilize the concept of tracking area list, given in 3GPP release 8. One of the objectives of 5G mobile network is to cope up with an ever-increasing number of UEs. This paper forms a basis for TA reconfiguration in 5G network using game theory, and finds an optimal solution for optimizing the signalling overhead of the network. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: IMC - Modified PID Load Frequency Controller for Two Area Interconnected System with WPU
dc:creator: Sonkar P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The numerous switching of loads created the noisy circumstantial for LFC. Hence, the present article exemplified a smaller amount noise sensitive controller entitled as modified proportional integral derivative (MPID) controller for load frequency control of the two area interconnected system involving thermal power unit and wind power unit. The introduced controller is articulated thru incorporating low pass filter with PID controller. The internal model control exploits to tune the parameter of MPID load frequency control. The wind power has increases its share in renewable energy sources and therefore, IMC-MPID load frequency controller demonstrates with wind power plant without frequency regulation capability and with inertial control. MATLAB/Simulink has employed for simulation. The frequency and tie line power deviation reduces for IMC-MPID load frequency controller for both cases. Hence, proposed controller has evidenced its aptness. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: VME system based technique for IGBT Switching and Current Control
dc:creator: Sharma D.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: IGBT switching and current control technique has been developed using VME system. This technique uses VME digital input and output (DIO) card, IP330 analog in (AI) module and VME interrupt programming. This technique has been successfully used in switching and current control of IGBT based power supply of Radial Control Coil (RCC) of SST-1. The gate pulse trigger interface is of TTL type. With IGBT driver circuit, VME DIO card and IP330 AI module can be used for hysteresis band control of IGBT power circuit. Time response of DIO card is analyzed in isolation and along with feedback processing and status monitoring. DIO card pulse trigger rise and fall time along with feedback processing have been analyzed in detail to ensure 10 kHz switching range of IGBT. DIO card used for switching of IGBT has a very low-rise time of 30 ns and fall time of 170 ns. It alone can provide very high switching at TTL voltage interface. With appropriate driver circuit interface, VME system can be used for switching and current control of any IGBT based power supply using hysteresis band control technique. Feedback current is acquired using IP330 analog in module. Reference current (Iref) is provided through FO link interface in digital format. IP330 acquires feedback (I                             <sub>fback</sub>                             ) signal at acquisition rate of 10kHz with external clock trigger. Interrupt base processing has been programmed in VME system. Interrupt is generated through IP330 module after acquisition of all converted channels. Combination of VME DIO and VME IP330 Analog In module a feedback current and switching techniques have been successfully developed. Time response of VME modules and interrupt programming, results of output voltage waveforms at RCC power supply and MATLAB simulation are presented in this paper.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A CP-free STBC-MIMO OFDM communication system for underwater multipath channel
dc:creator: Oshiro S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper proposes a Space Time Block Code (STBC) MIMO OFDM system without Cyclic Prefix (CP) but robust for long multipath echo channel, targeting the horizontal direction underwater communication. The system consists of two transmitting elements and more than 3 receiving elements. The configuration of STBC in this paper is 2 × 3 or 2 × 4. STBC-OFDM symbol length is 32 ms with 512 sampling points. Under multipath condition without CP, Inter Symbol Interference (ISI) and Inter Carrier Interference (ICI) happens and causes severe communication performance degradation. In the proposed system, the ISI is removed by multiplying Left Null Space Vectors based on measured Channel Impulse Responses (CIRs) and the ICI is minimized by multiplying Minimum Mean Square Error (MMSE) weight. By increasing the number of receiving element (transducer), the Left Null Space Vectors can be obtained. To verify the ISI and ICI suppression performance, Matlab computer simulation is used. For 2 × 3 STBC-MIMO cases, roughly 150 (16QAM) and 190 (QAM) sampling points delayed multipath has been compensated successfully. For 2 × 4 STBC-MIMO cases, more than 250 (16QAM and QPSK) sampling points delayed multipath also compensated. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Study of Extended SM scheme over Generalized α - μ fading channel
dc:creator: Khatoon A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Zakir Husain College of Engineering and Technology

abstract: In this paper, performance of Extended Spatial Modulation (ESM) scheme for multi input multi output systems over uncorrelated flat fading α - μ channel have been evaluated using simulation and studied. The existing sub-optimal threshold detection method with lesser complexity is implemented at the receiver. The effects of varying the transmitter diversity, spectral efficiency and receiver diversity on the bit error rate (BER) performance have also been discussed. The comparative study of spectral efficiency ESM with spatial modulation SM has also been presented. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Survey Paper on Multicarrier Modulation Techniques
dc:creator: Mrinalini
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Formidable growth of mobile data rate in wireless communication requires a waveform which can handle wide bandwidth data rate signals and give provision of low latency transmissions for long as well as short data bursts applications. The most suitable waveform for high data rate communication can be GFDM. Its flexibility allows presence of CP-OFDM and equalization in single carrier frequency domain. In this paper, we analyze the important characteristics of GFDM and comparison of GFDM with OFDM, FBMC and UFMC. Motive of this paper is to come out with the most prominent and suitable multicarrier modulation waveform that can be used in 5G cellular network. Paper comprises of introduction to GFDM had proved to be the concept to spread the available spectrum for each user into multiple spectral segments, each of those segments having more or less bandwidth. After introducing GFDM, paper comprise of disadvantages of OFDM, FBMC and UFMC which made GFDM to be most suitable for 5G. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Isolated Zeta Converter Fed SRM Drive with High Power Conversion Efficiency
dc:creator: Anand A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper presents an isolated Zeta converter with two equal output voltages for a midpoint converter fed four phase SRM drive. The high frequency transformer of the proposed converter is designed to operate in discontinuous conduction mode (DCM) to reduce input current THD (Total Harmonic Distortion) less than 5% and power factor close to unity. The main feature of the converter, is to emulate a resistive circuit to the supply mains to provide power factor correction (PFC). The speed of SRM is controlled by regulating two output voltages of the proposed converter over a wide range as the drive speed is considered here as a function of converter output voltage. Experimental results on a 200 W prototype of proposed converter fed SRM drive, are presented to verify the improved power quality operation of the proposed drive at different supply voltages and loading conditions. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Pentagonal Monopole Patch Antenna for UWB, X-Band and Ku-Band with Parasitic Resonator
dc:creator: Singh M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In the paper a monopole patch antenna for the UWB and KU-band is presented. The proposed antenna design is introduced with an additional parasitic element which results in the bandwidth extension of the reference design to the KU-band and three rectangular slots in the patch parallel to each other and of same dimension. The proposed antenna gain is also acceptable for the complete band of operations and the VSWR value for the antenna is lesser than 2 for the complete band. Bandwidth of the proposed antenna is between 3.7GHz to 18.5GHz, the simulated gain is varying between 2.5dB to 6.76dB and the radiation efficiency is more than 60% for more than half of the bandwidth and efficiency is maximum at 17.3GHz of 78.6%. This proposed antenna founds its application in the satellite communication, WLAN bands and WiMAX bands. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Modified Seven Level Cascaded H Bridge Inverter
dc:creator: Yarlagadda A.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Presently Multilevel inverters are extensively used for high-voltage applications and their execution is exceptionally better to that of regular two-level inverters due to minimized harmonic distortion, lower electromagnetic interference and larger DC link voltages. Nevertheless certain shortcomings are faced such as adding in number of components and voltage balancing problem. In order to overcome these, a seven-level hybrid inverter has been proposed. This topology requires a lesser number of power switches which results in the decrease of multifaceted nature, add up to cost and weight of the inverter. Finally this can be able to generate near sinusoidal voltages and approximately fundamental frequency switching. The simulation and the experimental results of a modified cascaded seven level H bridge inverter with and without LC filter are presented for validation. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Analysis of Different Types of Core Materials in Photonic Crystal Fiber
dc:creator: Sharma R.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Photonic crystal fiber is a widely searched research area which grabs the attention of researchers towards this field. Actually since last two decade innovations and experiments have been increased in this field. Here various materials and design are used for calculation of dispersion, minimizing the loss, verifying the refractive index [13 14, 15] of the material used etc. Since Photonic crystal fibers [10]-[15] have various properties among them the above mentioned are widely used to calculate and measure in every design and structure. In this paper we tried to compare the above mentioned properties of various materials like the conventional material of PCF [10]-[11] is Silica Glass [1]-[2], borosilicate crown glass (BK7) [3], chalcogenide glass [4]-[5], Borofloat glass [6], GE 124 NSG OZ, Vycor [7]-[8] and Soda Lime [9]. Apart from the mentioned properties we have also considered some other physical and chemical properties of these materials. To compare all these properties of these materials we used to refer various articles and research papers then finally concluded that all the three material have their own merits and demerits and they shows their properties in best manner for the selected wavelength region. We have prepared various tables with the data collected and draw graphs between them to show the variation of these parameters for various material used. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Regulation of DC Bus Voltage for DC MicroGrid Using PSIM
dc:creator: Singh G.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Today the DC Microgrid has achieved popularity due to its easy interconnection with renewable energy resources and high reliability. This paper presents the voltage regulation of DC microgrid using a solar photovoltaic module, Li-ion Battery and AC grid as an input source. The outputs of these three inputs are interconnected with help of buffer circuit and are fed to dc bus. The voltage across DC bus is maintained to a certain desired value, which is being further regulated to four different lower voltages with help of buck converters. Buffer circuits are used to monitor the instantaneous power imbalance between source and load of the entire circuit. The boost converter is connected along the PV module and Li-ion battery respectively to regulate the output voltage of these sources to the desired value which is being fed to dc bus. The Maximum Power Point Tracking is also connected to the PV module which is essential to drive the system to the maximum power point to obtain the much efficiency. The system is modelled and simulated in the PSIM working environment. The dc bus voltage is also regulated to four different voltages levels so that the different dc household loads can be connected through it. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Online Food Court Payment System using Blockchain Technolgy
dc:creator: Yadav A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: it is a web and cellular-based app designed commonly for use in the meals beverage enterprise. These apps solve the problems of labour cost in the restaurants and food court resulting in an increase in overall business. It also provides the owner to manage and make changes as per the requirements in the shop. The customer can order their food by accessing the food app through their mobile. The shopkeeper can easily complete the order in time, as there will be a regular check-in for the availability of ingredients. In this paper, we will be representing the overall description and software requirement specification of the entire system designed for use in different food courts. Our apps will provide the restaurant employees to manage their online menu and keep track of all the orders placed by their customers. The customers will be able to access the menu from anywhere so they can order their food and collect it immediately after it is ready. Inside this paper, we have depicted a general model of the framework, layouts of functional and non-functional prerequisites, and a definite portrayal of the UI. Eventually, this idea represents an account of the expansion of the device alongside predicted protection. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Economical Load Dispatch Using Modified Harmony Memory Search Optimization Technique
dc:creator: Mulo T.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology, Shibpur

abstract: This paper presents a modified Harmony Search optimization technique in solving the economic load dispatch problem in a power system network. A Six-Unit System consisting of 6 thermal power units, 46 transmission lines and 26 buses have been considered for the fulfillment of economic load dispatch criterion. A comparison of the simulation output made between the results obtained by the proposed Harmony search method with that of Particle Swarm Optimization and Genetic Algorithm has been presented. The MATLAB simulation results reveal that the proposed MHMS based approach provides better results in terms of loss minimization though it involves a marginally higher operating cost. © 2018 IEEE.
author-keyword: Economic load dispatch (ELD) and Fitness Value (FV)

dc:title: Large Signal Analysis of a Tapered Disc-Loaded Gyro-TWT
dc:creator: Singh R.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In the present paper, a tapered disc-loaded gyro- TWT amplifier has been investigated using large signal approach in order to observe the gain-frequency response and output power growth along the interaction structure length. Various tapering schemes have been analysed in order to get wider device bandwidth along with appreciable gain. It has been found that increase in waveguide wall radius resulted in large output power and gain without significant alteration in mid-band frequency. The increase in disc-hole radius causes decrease in device bandwidth with rise in the gain of device. Further, combination of two tapering schemes, i.e., tapering the waveguide wall radius for the purpose of improving the gain and tapering the disc-hole radius for widebanding, has been investigated. It has been found that combined tapering scheme results in improvement of device gain and bandwidth. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Tum-to- Tum Fault Detection in Indirect Symmetrical PST Based on Negative Sequence Current Components
dc:creator: Bhasker S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper proposes an algorithm for the protection of Indirect Symmetrical Phase Shift Transformer (ISPST) during minor internal turn-to-turn fault conditions. The proposed algorithm is amalgamation of negative sequence component of current and Phase Angle Shift (PAS). The proposed protection algorithm is able to detect all the internal faults occurred in both the units (series unit and excitation unit) of an ISPST. The algorithm is also evaluated to detect minor Turn-to-Turn (TT) internal fault of 1% shorted winding. In addition to that effect of CT saturation during external fault has also been considered. The simulation of different fault conditions in an ISPST has been performed using PSCAD/EMTDC platform. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Decision Making for E-learners based on Learning Style, Personality, and Knowledge Level
dc:creator: Goyal M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: With the increase of internet usage, most of the learners go for e-learning systems for all kinds of learning activities. E-learning has been able to provide support to all learners through a wide range of materials for every topic. But the availability of large materials and resources has caused difficulty in selecting the optimized material. The learners find it difficult to select the right resource based on their criteria for learning. Going through many resources on same topics lead to learners losing his interest or dropping the idea of learning online. Thus, a recommender system that will provide the users right and optimized path of learning is essential. The idea is to recommend a learner the material that will suit his/her style and will help him/her learn quickly in an optimized manner. This paper estimates the learning style, personality and the knowledge level of a learner in order to recommend the next topics he/she should learn. The results from all of these three questionnaires are put into an algorithm named as aggregation using intuitionistic fuzzy genetic algorithm. This gave us the aggregated values for each student and the next task of classifying a student is done using the KNN classifier. The classes to which a student could belong are termed as low, low-medium, medium, medium-high and high. These classes will group together students having nearly same aggregate values and with similar learning, personality and knowledge levels. This will in turn help us to provide the learners with the material that would suit them and help them to progress at a much better pace. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Conducting artificial enzymatic nanocubes based electronic sensor for simultaneous detection of hemoglobin and glycated hemoglobin in diabetic patients
dc:creator: Pandey I.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Artificial enzymes are man-made enzymes which mimics the natural enzymes and can be use in various biomedical applications. In this paper, nanocubes shape conducting artificial enzymes modified flexible electrochemical sensor was fabricated for simultaneous sensing of glycated hemoglobin and hemoglobin where percentage of glycated hemoglobin is proven gold biomarker for diabetes. The simultaneous electrochemical sensing of hemoglobin and glycated hemoglobin is achieved using conducting artificial enzymatic nanocube based flexible carbon paste aluminium foil. Here, conducting artificial enzymatic nanocubes are prepared by molecular imprinting technology which promoted the fast kinetics of redox process and low detection limit of both hemoglobin and glycated hemoglobin with linear response of concentrations. The characteristic well define symmetrical separate peaks for both hemoglobin and glycated hemoglobin was obtained in aqueous and human blood samples. This novel cheap flexible sensor with remarkable dual selectivity and sensitivity could be used to determine hemoglobin and glycated hemoglobin at ultra-trace level in diabetic patient blood sample with 0.07 μM and 0.09 μM detection limit. Thus proposed flexible sensor can be a smart wearable sensor for diabetic monitoring. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Bandpass Frequency Selective Surface with Wide Shielding Effectiveness
dc:creator: Singh C.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper presents a novel frequency selective surface topology in X-band with 14.6 % fractional bandwidth from extending from 10.39 GHz to 12.02 GHz. Four transmission zeros at 8.5 GHz, 9.5 GHz, 12.6 GHz and 15.5 GHz have introduced to increase the shielding effectiveness in the stop band of the FSS. The shielding effectiveness is better than 10 dB near the lower and upper -3dB cut-off frequencies. It extends over 1.96 GHz in lower stopband and 4.24 GHz in higher stopband region. Due to the sharper transition in the transition region, it offers a high selectivity needed for many applications. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Standalone Hybrid Power Generation using Photovoltaics, Battery and Bio-gas
dc:creator: Anand K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: This paper presents an off-grid hybrid power system. This hybrid power is sustained by three power sources, i.e., sunlight based power by photovoltaics, battery bank, and bio-gas. To meet a relatively downsized electricity demand in comparison to main grid load, i.e., the load of small villages, household appliances or small domestic industries of the order of 1.6 MW, a satisfactory amount of generation can be available using the hybrid bio-gas plant, results in meeting the peak demand and getting the garbage used. The results of the simulation evinces that the amplitudes and periods of AC yield voltage are very much controlled. It is estimated that this type of power generation system, in which renewable energies are being utilized, will supply electric power and give security of the earth in rustic areas and rural zone with no reliance on grid control supply. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: An Approach to Enhance the Life of Transformer and the Battery of Gridable Vehicles
dc:creator: Karki M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The depleting non-renewable energy resources, climate change issues and sustainability in energy sector have become more prominent than ever before. Meanwhile, increased number of distributed generations, controllable loads, and renewable energy sources in electrical system has threatened network flexibility, security and equipment performances. This paper proposed new methodology which deals with two main objectives. The first objective is proposed to improve the life of substation distribution transformer by controlling its inside heating. To obtain so, the loading in the transformer is controlled continuously and maintain below limit most of time. The second objective is to improve the average of the remaining cycles of battery in the gridable vehicles. Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) has been used to carry out optimal power flow considering loss minimization and voltage deviation minimization in objective function. The test system is IEEE-33 bus system. The result shows enhancement of life of transformer and the battery of gridable vehicles with and without proposed methodology. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Novel 10T SRAM cell for Low Power Applications
dc:creator: Bansal M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: This paper represents a novel ten transistor based static random access memory (SRAM) architecture with high read noise margin for low power applications. The novel 10T SRAM cell architecture has been designed, using cadence virtuoso tool in 45nm CMOS technology. Its performance characteristics such as read/write delay, leakage power dissipation, read stability, write-ability, Static Noise Margins have been examined and compared with different 6T and 8T SRAM cell architectures. The simulation results reveal appreciable improvement in stability, read behavior and consumes least power at the cost of area overhead. The proposed cell has a Read Noise margin of 220 mV while for the conventional 6T cell it is 80 mV. Energy efficiency for the proposed P10T cell is found to be 4.07 eV while for the conventional 6T it is 4.87 eV. All simulations have been carried out at 0.4 volts supply voltage. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Study of SigmoidSpectral Composite Kernel based noise classifier with entropy in handling non linear separation of classes
dc:creator: Sengupta I.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper gives an implemented explanation of incorporating composite kernel methods with fuzzy based image classifiers. The work demonstrates how non linearity among the different classes of remote sensing data with uncertainty are handled with Noise classifier with entropy(fuzzy classifier) using composite kernel technique for land use/land cover maps generation. This study has incorporated the composition of two prominent kernels Spectral and Sigmoid Kernel. The performance of the classifier is evaluated in supervised mode and, the assessment of accuracy has been carried out using FERM (Fuzzy Error Matrix), SCM (Sub-pixel Confusion Uncertainty Matrix). The basic objective is to optimize the resolution parameter '(δ', regularizing parameter 'v' and weight factor λ for Composite Kernel based Noise clustering with entropy classifier (Composite-KNCWE) and analysis of the classified fraction images. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: RFPA Nonlinearity Compensation with MIMO Diversity for Indoor Channels
dc:creator: Agrawal A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The multiple-input-multiple-output (MIMO) technology has become an essential element for 4G/5G wireless communication systems to achieve the necessities of higher data rates and communication reliability. Radio frequency power amplifier (RFPA) is the critical source of power consumption in such systems and produces nonlinear distortion due to its saturation property. This nonlinearity impairment is required to be essentially compensated as it further degrades the block error rate (BLER), error vector magnitude (EVM) and throughput performance of the data transmission through the wireless communication system due to which the advantages of MIMO systems like diversity gain and multiplexing gain cannot be fully achieved. This paper analyzes the effect of RFPA nonlinearity compensation using digital predistortion (DPD) with different MIMO configurations for the propagation conditions in the urban cities having very high traffic using MIMO diversity scheme. The paper establishes that better data rates as well as reliable data communication is achieved with higher order MIMO configurations. Moreover, RFPA nonlinearity compensation provides 6 times improvement in BLER, 2.77 times in throughput and about 2 times improvement in EVM measurements with MIMO 4×1 diversity at 15 dB signal-to-noise ratio (SNR). © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Comparative Analysis for Optimal Placement of DG and Capacitor for Loss Minimization in Benchmark Network
dc:creator: Srivastava A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: This paper presents a comparative analysis of two simple methodologies for reducing the power losses and to improve the voltage profile of benchmark distribution network. First objective of this paper is to present the methodology for optimal placement of distributed generation (DG), that is, to determine the optimal number, the size, and location of the critical buses for placement of DG in distribution system in order to minimize the losses and also to ensure acceptable voltage profile. Therefore initially, critical buses (violating the specified criterion) are recognized by carrying out the analysis of power flow without DG placement in the benchmark system. Load flow analysis is then performed after placement of DG to observe the effect DG has on voltage profile and losses of the system. Further, the second objective of this paper is to propose the methodology for optimal placement of capacitors to reduce the power loss in the network and to ensure acceptable voltage profile. IEEE-13 node benchmark distribution system is used for carrying out the analysis using the above mentioned methodologies. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Comparative Performance Analysis of OMP and SABMP for Massive MIMO OFDM Channel Estimation
dc:creator: Rao K.D.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The orthogonal matching pursuit (OMP) algorithm and Support Agnostic Bayesian matching pursuit (SABMP) algorithm for sparse channel estimation are reported in the literature. In this paper, the performance of these algorithms is analyzed for massive MIMO OFDM channel estimation. The greedy approach based SABMP algorithm orders its metric updates recursively to determine pre dominant sparsesupports to find MMSE estimate. Simulations are carried out to evaluate the normalized mean square error(NMSE) of OMP and SAMP for 5×5 MIMO with 32 pilot carriers. Further, the NMSE performance of SABMP algorithm is demonstrated for antenna arrays of size(5 × 5, 10 × 10, 20×20) with 16 pilot carriers and varying sparsities (3,7), and QAMs (4,16). © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Detection of Event Related Potential for a Cognitive Task
dc:creator: Noor N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Zakir Husain College of Engineering and Technology

abstract: Event related potential (ERPs) are the small voltage changes in the brain representing the responses to external stimuli. ERPs have excellent temporal resolution therefore, it is considered as an accurate measure for the cognitive research. Electroencephalography (EEG) is a non-invasive technique and is most widely used to measure ERPs. The aim of this paper is to measure the ERPs in the cognitive task and detects or determines some of the components of ERPs. One of the ERP components which are found here is P300. P300 was elicited with auditory stimulus. The auditory stimulus was designed according to the oddball paradigm in which the participant detects a less frequent 'target' stimulus in a regular series of standard stimuli. This stimulus consists of series of alphabets and digits in which only digit is the target. Two age group people (20±5 years and 40±5 years) participated in this experiment. Then, P300 latency and amplitude are compared between these two age groups. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Rectangular Shaped Defected Ground structure Microstrip Patch Antenna for WiMAX Applications
dc:creator: Thatere A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Datta Meghe Institute of Engineering, Technology & Research

abstract: In the Digital world for communication purpose the basic requirement is Antenna which is small in size, better performance and easy to use. Diamond shaped micro- strip patch antenna for WiMAX application is designed, simulated and fabricated at frequency 5.15GHz to 5.35 GHz. The stimulated results are compared with the fabricated antenna. The reflection coefficient has value of -21.0031dB at frequency5.15GHz and -25.0955 dB at frequency 5.35GHz. Simulated and fabricated results such as Return loss (S11), BW, directivity, gain, radiation pattern and Voltage Standing Wave Ratio are compared. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A New Hierarchical Clustering Algorithm with Intersection Points
dc:creator: Nazari Z.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper builds upon our previous paper that has introduced a new hierarchical clustering algorithm. In this paper we attempted to solve algorithmic defects and use more validation measures to show the strength of our proposed algorithm. The main purpose of this clustering algorithm is to provide a better clustering quality and higher accuracy utilizing intersection points. To validate our clustering algorithm, we have performed several experiments with benchmark datasets. Besides our proposed algorithm, five well-known agglomerative clustering algorithms are also used. Purity as an external criterion is used to evaluate the performance of clustering algorithms. Compactness of each cluster derived by clustering algorithms is also calculated to evaluate the validity of clustering algorithms. Eventually, the results of experiments show that in most cases the error rate of our proposed algorithm is lower than other clustering algorithms which are used in this study. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Impact of Asymmetricity in Gate Oxide on the RF Performance of FDSOI MOSFET
dc:creator: Yadava N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: This paper presents the impact of asymmetricity in the double gate oxide material on the Radio Frequency (RF) performance of the single FDSOI MOSFET. The results are obtained by using 2D Atlas TCAD tool. From the simulated results it is observed that the cutoff frequency (IT) which is used as a key parameter to evaluate the High frequency performance of the device is smaller when the asymmetricity is near the source side and larger when the asymmetricity is near the drain side. © 2018 IEEE.
author-keyword: intrinsic capacitances and RF figure of merits

dc:title: Periodically Variable Antenna Pattern for Maximizing Path Diversity Gain in MIMO Receivers
dc:creator: Saito M.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: We propose a periodically variable antenna pattern (PVAP) that turns a receive antenna unit into multiple virtual antennas located at the same position without additional antenna elements. We also propose a multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) system model that considers the receiver with PVAP and derive the average channel capacity of the MIMO system. We show numerical results of the ergodic capacity of the system and conclude that the performance can be improved by path diversity gain and by increasing the number of virtual receive antennas. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: (UPCON) Fabrication of electro-spin coated Zn <inf>0.97</inf> Fe <inf>0.03</inf> O nano-rough thin film and application in LPG sensing
dc:creator: Nath Anchal B.B.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this paper presented to fabrication of Zn                             <sub>0.97</sub>                              Fe                             <sub>0.03</sub>                             O nano rough thin film by high rpm electro-spin technique and detection of LPG (Liquefied Petroleum Gas). The film grown technique is spin coating and doping part of 3 % iron in zinc oxide by chemical route. The Characterization of film by XRD, SEM, EDX and AFM. Observation of sensing for LPG as concentrations of 100 ppm, 300 ppm and 500 ppm at 50 °C in assembled gas sensing set up. The living maximum temperature around up to 50 °C in summer. So choosen LPG sensing at this temperature. The concept of iron doping in host zinc oxide for improved gas sensing properties. So, applied minimum 3 % iron doped zinc oxide thin film using in the sensing of LPG. The spin coating technique is inexpensive and easily operated.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A PSO based Fractional Order PI (FOPI) controller design for a Shunt Active Power Filter for Harmonic Elimination
dc:creator: Srivastava A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Shunt Active Power Filter (SAPF) are widely used for the reduction of Harmonics. In this study, a Fractional Order (FOPI) PI controller is designed to improve the performance of SAPF by maintaining a constant DC-Link voltage. The parameters of the FOPI control is tuned using a well known optimization technique, Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO). The results obtained are compared with a PI controller generally used for same application. The result shows that the proposed study provides better results in maintaining the voltage level and indirectly reducing the Harmonics. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Impact Assessment of Distributed Solar PV Integration in Low-Voltage Unbalanced Distribution Network: A Case Study
dc:creator: Singh B.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Ever increasing penetration level of distributed generation, mainly solar PV (SPV)into low voltage (LV) secondary distribution networks introduces several impacts on nominal operating conditions. This paper studies the impacts of distributed solar PV penetration in a low-voltage unbalanced distribution network of Indian Institute of Technology Gandhinagar (IITGN). The distribution network under study has total connected load around 2 MW with total solar PV penetration of 500 kWp in form of roof-top and ground mounted (solar carport). The quasi-static load flow study has been performed, considering one-hour resolution load power and distributed generation power data. Simulation results are discussed with respect to the bus voltage profile, active power injection at load bus, line losses, and source power factor with and without the solar PV injection. It is found that there is no reverse power flow at main feeder and voltage quality issue associated with this network. The analysis also hints at reduction in active power losses in the line due to SPV injection at the consumer location. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Improving PV Array Output during Partial Shading using Voltage Balancing Approach
dc:creator: Kumar Karmakar B.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Inhomogeneous insolation on a solar PV plant due to cloud, nearby construction, tree branches etc. reduces its power output significantly. Further, multiple peaks in power-voltage characteristics of the PV array are also observed due to partial shading, which calls for sophisticated and costly MPPT controller to make the the array operate at its global MPP. However, the enhancement in array output using global MPP is also limited by the array interconnections. This leaves scope for further improvement in array power output. In this work, a voltage balancing technique using DC-DC converters is developed to improve the array power output during partial shading. The results of simulation carried out to validate the proposed method for different shading level and pattern show its effectiveness in improving the power output. In addition, a case study on constant power load (CPL) using a PV-battery system demonstrates that the proposed strategy can also double as a demand-response controller for a PV array to feed CPL. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance Analysis of PMSG Wind Turbine at Variable Wind Speed
dc:creator: Nityanand
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In recent wind energy application PMSG (Permanent Magnet Synchronous Generator) is largely used. This paper reflects about the performance of PMSG Wind Turbine (WT) at constant and variable wind speed. WT is classified on the basis of type of operation i.e. full variable speed operations, semi variable speed operation and fixed speed operation. Squirrel Cage Induction Motor, PMSG, Wound Rotor Synchronous Generator and HTS-SG (High Temperature Superconducting Synchronous Generator) all these found application in Wind Energy Conversion System (WECS). Among all these PMSG is most popular and dominating in market share. PMSG is more popular in full speed variable operation WECS. In this paper, with the help of MATLAB / Simulink model of PMSG WT, a performance analysis at constant and variable wind speed is done. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Workspace and Singularity Analysis of Five Bar Planar Parallel Manipulator
dc:creator: Prasad R.B.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: This paper presents an analysis of workspace and singularity of a five-bar planar parallel manipulator with revolute joints. The traditional approach of kinematic analysis is not suitable for parallel manipulator. Therefore, the inverse kinematic approach is used for the workspace analysis. A simplified equation for tracing the boundary of the workspace is presented. Practically, the manipulator stops or fails to operate after traveling certain distance within the workspace due to the occurrence of singularity, therefore singularity must be avoided for a smooth operation of manipulator. In the present paper, the mathematical conditions for the three kinds of singularity of five-bar planar parallel manipulator are derived, which is based on Jacobian matrices and represent the corresponding singularity configuration. The results are useful to the design, manufacturing and control of a five-bar planar parallel manipulator. This kind of analysis is very important while designing the industrial robotic manipulator. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Comparison between Sliding Mode Control and Feedback Linearization
dc:creator: Prasad G.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: in this paper we take a 2- link robotic Manipulator system, which is nonlinear in nature. First we convert the nonlinear system into linear system. To control the system torque is derived with linear approximation. SMC and Feedback Linearization is applied to track the desired trajectory. The desired trajectories is taken with different frequencies and the controlling of two scheme with different trajectories is evaluated with the help of Simulink. A comparison between SMC and Feedback linearization is detailed with regard different frequencies of desired trajectory. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Design Optimization of Electrical Busbars of Power Distribution System using Taguchi Method
dc:creator: Zanje S.R.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The present article describes an approach for design optimization of the thermal performance of electrical busbars used in a unique box-less type power distribution system using DOE and computational simulation optimization technique. The goal of the considered approach is to define a real concurrent process for the design of reliable busbar systems for low voltage distribution application. There are several factors which are responsible for the thermal losses such as material properties, the magnitude of current, contact resistance and topological aspects etc. The objective of this study is to optimize the design parameters of novel distribution box and enhance its overall performance using the statistical method- Taguchi optimization technique and compared with the design parameters obtained using a computational algorithm. A model, containing all the requisite design factors such as sizes, material and electrical characteristic were created using FEM package of COMSOL Multiphysics and Minitab. The results of simulation are verified and validated experimentally in the laboratory. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Model Predictive Control Approaches for Induction Motor in Virtual Environment
dc:creator: Kamat S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: The MPC approaches, namely, Implicit and Explicit MPC are described in this paper from implementation and analysis point of view for the control of the speed and air gap flux of an induction motor in simulated environment. The comparison of the closed loop performance of the said approaches is expected to help the step of Model in Loop validation of control software development. This could ease and speed up its implementation on the embedded hardware that serves as integral part of induction motor drive. The work develops a Linear Time Variant state space model for a squirrel cage induction motor of known electrical equivalent circuit parameters using fundamental equations. The IMPC and EMPC controller actions are computed by constructing and solving optimization problems using Quadratic Programming approach and multi-parametric PWA solver approach respectively. The tracking performance for speed set point trajectory and the rejection of disturbance torque acting on the shaft are simulated and compared along with the trade-offs. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Performance Analysis of Different Bootstrap Inverter Configurations using Dual Gate OTFT
dc:creator: Mishra N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: This paper presents the parameter extraction of various bootstrap techniques in terms of both static and dynamic performance. There are two configurations presented in the paper namely, Zero-V                             <sub>GS</sub>                              load logic (ZVLL) and diode load logic (DLL). The performance is analyzed using three parameters -voltage gain, voltage transfer characteristics and dynamic response. This is an effective technique to overcome the threshold voltage drop in digital logic circuits. Comparison among these reveals that DLL configuration gives better dynamic results as compared to the ZVLL inverter. The paper concludes with the implementation of future issues to minimize the propagation delay and improve the noise margin. The comparison of performance in terms of static and dynamic responses of these three techniques is also dealt with.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Dual-Band Dual-Beam Microstrip Patch Antenna for Intelligent Transportation Systems Application
dc:creator: Tripathi S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this work, a compact dual-band and dual-beam patch antenna is reported for Intelligent Transportation Systems applications. The 5.9 GHz band is specifically allocated for the ITS purpose and enables flexible implementation of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS). CST Microwave Studio has been used in the full wave simulation of proposed antenna. The fabricated prototype has been characterized in an anechoic chamber. Measured and simulated reflection coefficient at desired WLAN/ITS band of this antenna is better than -20 dB at 5.3 GHz and -15 dB for 5.9 GHz while the measured gain of the antenna is 4.8 and 5.7dBi at 5.3 GHz and 5.9 GHz, respectively. The simulated far-field (3D) radiation pattern of the antenna shows dual-beam radiation pattern. The simple physical geometry of the antenna is attractive for use in intelligent transportation systems. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Evaluation of Reverse Ellitism Firefly Algorithm on the CEC2013 Real Parameter Single Objective Optimization Benchmark Functions
dc:creator: Pathak A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College, Durgapur

abstract: This paper proposes a modified firefly algorithm (RE-FA), namely Reverse Ellitism Firefly Algorithm. The primary objective of this algorithm is faster convergence around global minima for training of Neural Networks in continious domain. The secondary objective of this modified Firefly Algorithm was to consider all parameters namely α, β,γ to be adaptive in accordance to the objective function. No a-priori knowledge of the problem domain is required, as such; no preset or tuning of the said parameters is required beforehand. A failsafe criterion for clearance of local minima is also applied. The tendency of standard Firefly algorithm to get stuck in local minima and slow convergence is mitigated by applying reverse ellitism in RE-FA. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: SAW Correlators in LiN bO3 and GaN on Sapphire
dc:creator: Ghosh S.
prism:publicationName: IFCS 2018 - IEEE International Frequency Control Symposium
abstract: This paper describes the use of Lithium Niobate and GaN on sapphire substrates to define SAW correlators for direct sequence spread spectrum modulation. Passive correlators with maximal length sequence periods of 7 and 15 are fabricated and tested on 128° Y-cut bulk Lithium Niobate. The input transducer is modulated at carrier frequencies of 470-930 MHz with a chip duration of 100 n s. At the output, a maximum peak-to-sidelobe ratio of 15 dB is measured. The same design is then fabricated in GaN on sapphire in order to incorporate acoustoelectric gain sections using an AlGaN barrier engineered to ensure low sheet density. We consider a basic cell consisting of a tap followed by a gain section to support long correlator structures. This represents a first step towards mitigating acoustic propagation losses in monolithic GaN SAW correlators. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Compact Band Notched Monopole Antenna with Defected Ground Plane for UWB Applications
dc:creator: Gupta S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: The paper deals, a compact circular shaped multi band notched monopole antenna is proposed for UWB operations with defected ground surface structure. This type of antenna consists of three U slots and one I slot into the radiation patch and feedline and ground plane is defected by placing two inverted U shaped slots into it. By cutting these slots, multi band notched properties in the WiMAX band (3.5 / 5.5 GHz), C band (4 GHz), WLAN band (5.2 / 5.8 GHz), National Information Infrastructure band (U-NII) (5.15 / 5.825 GHz), RFID band (6.6 / 7.1 GHz) and ITU uplink satellite communication band (8.1 / 8.4 GHz) are obtained. This compact antenna has an appropriate size of 16.5∗16.5 mm2 and has UWB applications in X band (8 / 12 GHz), upper S band (2 / 4 GHz) and operates from 3.2973 to 11.9310 GHz frequency range. After doing the simulation on HFSS software, we get improved return loss, antenna efficiency, VSWR, antenna gain and radiation patterns. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: A Robust Trust Model for Wireless Sensor Networks
dc:creator: Gautam A.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs) are vulnerable to various security attacks due to its broadcast nature. Trust management is one of the effective methods to defend against threats posed to WSN. The trust management system helps to mitigate many insider attacks and malicious behaviour of nodes. In this paper, we proposed a robust trust model that prevents various attacks viz; bad mouthing, self-promoting and collusion attacks. It uses the time lapses function based on forgetting curve to calculate direct trust and reputation function for indirect trust. Our proposed trust model is scalable. When the trust value is above the threshold value, then we consider a communication link as active and node is trusted, otherwise we remove the communication link and mark the node as malicious. The simulation results indicate the effectiveness of proposed method and maximizes the defence against the internal attacks. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Role of High-k in 32nm FDSOI MOS Transistor for High Frequency Applications
dc:creator: Pandey A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: In this paper, we analyze the role of using silicon nitride (Si                             <sub>3</sub>                             N                             <sub>4</sub>                             ) and hafnium dioxide (Hf02) as a high-k dielectric material on analog and RF performance of 32nm fully depleted silicon-on-insulator (FDSOI) MOSFET. From the analysis, it is observed that Hf02 provides better analog performance in term of transconductance and reduces leakage current as compare to Si                             <sub>3</sub>                             N                             <sub>4</sub>                             but for RF performance in terms of cut-off frequency (f                             <sub>T</sub>                             ) and transconductance frequency product (TFP) negligible improvement is found between Si                             <sub>3</sub>                             N                             <sub>4</sub>                             and Hf02. It is also found that in IC design the high value of k is not preferred for high frequency applications and also fabrication is easy by using Si                             <sub>3</sub>                             N                             <sub>4</sub>                             as compare to Hf02. Therefore, Hf02 is used for low power applications and for high frequency applications Si                             <sub>3</sub>                             N                             <sub>4</sub>                             is preferred. All the design and simulation is carried out through ATLAS 2D TCAD simulator.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Deep Learning based Command Pointing direction estimation using a single RGB Camera
dc:creator: Jaiswal S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad

abstract: Gesture based communication with humanoid robots, especially using hand gestures has universal appeal and could make humanoid robots share home space in a social environment if the technology can be developed in a matured fashion. Till date conventional vision based gesture recognition has had poor success rate since hand engineered features failed to communicate the gesture semantics unambiguously, especially when the gesture is dynamic in nature. This research proposes a deep convolutional neural network based technique that is able to estimate the command direction represented by a finger pointing gesture, with a considerably high accuracy. Moreover, the proposed architecture is able to estimate the direction of finger pointing using only a single two-dimensional RGB image of the hand gesture without using any depth information or stereo-vision techniques making the system computationally and physically less expensive which is particularly suitable for the real time applications such as communicating with the humanoid robots in a home environment. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Four Element Dual-band Sub-6 GHz 5G MIMO Antenna Using SRR-loaded Slot-Loops
dc:creator: Sarkar D.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this paper, a four element MIMO configuration is proposed for possible application in sub-6 GHz 5G wireless access points working in 3 - 4 GHz frequency bands. The proposed antenna uses microstrip-fed square slot-loops loaded with split-ring resonators (SRRs) to achieve miniaturized multiband performance, where extended bandwidth is achieved in the higher frequency range by merging of two narrow bands. Ansys HFSS simulations are used to explain the design methodology of the proposed antenna, by studying its impedance bandwidth, mutual coupling, simulated 3D radiation patterns as well as surface current distribution features. The proposed MIMO antenna exhibits excellent diversity performance (ECC < 0.1) and MEG-ratio within ±3 dB in uniform propagation scenario. The robustness of the proposed MIMO antenna is further checked for indoor Gaussian / Uniform propagation environment for a wide- range of scenario parameters. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Substrate Integrated Waveguide Leaky Wave Antenna with Continuous Beam Steering
dc:creator: Belwal P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: In this paper substrate integrated waveguide leaky wave antenna operating in the frequency range of 10-15.7 GHz using asymmetric slots is presented. The unit cell consist of a combination of transverse and longitudinal slots on the top layer of the substrate integrated waveguide as a series and shunt radiating elements respectively. A asymmetric technique is used to mitigate the open stop band. The antenna continuously steers the main beam from -48° to 18° to including broadside at 13.5 GHz with a maximum gain of 13 dBi. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Feature based leaf identification
dc:creator: Singh N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: Eyes are the important sense organ of human body. It allows visual perception by reacting to light and pressure. Human eyes are capable to differentiate approximate 10 million colors. It contains more than 2 million tissues and cells. Therefore human eyes are known as a prominent sense organ but sometimes it get confused to identify the things which are approximately similar in appearance but actually different. One of the common example is differentiating the Azadirachta indicaneem (Neem) tree and Melia azedarach (Bakain) tree leaves. As bakain tree is slightly harmful if consumed thus it is essential to distinguish between these two leaves. Therefore, an automated approach have been proposed to distinguish between neem tree leaves and bakain tree leaves with the help of texture features of the leaves and then classifying them in different categories by using machine learning. The performance of proposed approach by using tree classifier is 99.8%, which is found better with respect to the other classifiers like k-NN, SVM, etc. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Detection of ECG Fiducial Points using Moving Average Filters for Diagnosis of Cardiac Disease
dc:creator: Choudhary S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: This paper is an approach to develop an easy, effective and robust algorithm for the detection of ECG fiducial points and thereby using the information provided by these fiducial points for the analysis of the patient's cardiac health. This algorithm makes use of Adaptive Thresholding and Moving Average Filters for QRS Complex detection. The identification of P-wave and T-wave is carried out by a simple search forward and backward procedure. The algorithm has been tested on several ECG data available on online database i.e. PhysioNet with sampling frequency ranging from 128Hz-1 KHz. The accuracy of this technique has been determined on the results obtained by two statistical parameters i.e.; Positive Predictivity (+P) and sensitivity(SE). © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Novel Feeder Pillar Box
dc:creator: Jain I.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Present industrial connections demand an improved and continuous power supply at lowest possible cost and minimum infrastructure cost. A feeder pillar form a critical component of the distribution infrastructure in low voltage segment. In this paper, we discuss a unique feeder pillar concept with technologically advanced features. Among the feature that has been added are online health monitoring, temper- proof, touch proof, reduced losses and 100% accessibility of internal components with a minimalistic footprint. In addition, a unique modular busbar layout has been designed for reduced footprint with excellent heat dissipation and lowest possible components. At the sub-system level, a novel connector has been designed and developed showing exceptional characterization results to have a low contact resistance for reduced losses. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Review Paper on Solar Tapping -a Sustainable Resource
dc:creator: Mishra P.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Madan Mohan Malaviya University of Technology

abstract: The sustainable power source has huge potential which can meet the worlds energy demand easily by utilizing the easily accessible Renewable energy source. International energy agency (IEA) shows, in a relative report on the world energy utilization that in 2050 sun based exhibit establishment will give around 45 % of world vitality request. Sun powered vitality is a standout amongst the most essential sustainable power source which assumes an incredible part in giving energy arrangements. As known there is wide assortment of sort of authorities and utilizations of sun powered energy. This paper expected to make a short audit on sun oriented energy framework, as indicated by kinds of collectors and application utilized. Sun oriented energy is the best sustainable power source. Photovoltaic cells are utilized to change over sunlight-based energy to electrical energy. Photovoltaic can create power for an extensive variety of use. The solar based subsequent framework in the interest for sustainable power source is planned as a consequence to collect free energy by the sunlight. save it in battery and convert this energy so for exchanging current. This paper presents a review of the accessible writing covering the different types of PV modules based on generation of solar cell and their application in regarding electrical as well as thermal. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Optical invstigations of thermally evaporated Ge10Se60Te30 and Ge8Se60Te30In2 chalcogenide thin film for optical memory devices
dc:creator: Singh P.K.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: M. M. M. University of Technology

abstract: A comparative study of optical constants (% T, α, k and Eg) for thermally evaporated Ge                             <sub>10</sub>                             Se                             <sub>60</sub>                             Te                             <sub>30</sub>                             and Ge                             <sub>8</sub>                             Se                             <sub>60</sub>                             Te                             <sub>30</sub>                             In                             <sub>2</sub>                             thin films have been done in the present study. xray diffraction study revealed structural information of prepared films. SEM and EDS measurements are used for surface morphology and elemental analysis respectively. The optical band gap (Eg) of quaternary compound is found to be more as compared to ternary thin film and this increment is explained using electronegativity of glassy alloys.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Comparative Analysis of Buried-Gate GaN OPFET Models for UV Photodetector Applications
dc:creator: Gaitonde J.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: We estimate the UV (Ultraviolet) characteristics of the buried-gate GaN OPFET (Optical Field Effect Transistor) models and analyze the results based on the photoconductive and the photovoltaic effects. The various detector parameters are evaluated. Two distinct illumination models are considered for the present work (the front-illuminated and the back-illuminated buried-gate OPFETs). The device is biased in the saturation region of operation with the gate shorted to the source and is studied under different radiation flux densities. Both the illumination models exhibit significantly high UV response with the front-illuminated OPFET showing superior performance at the lower flux densities whereas the back-illuminated model showing better response at the higher flux density with a compromise in the bandwidth. The results demonstrate that the devices under study exhibit greater performance potential than many of the photo detectors reported in the literature under review. The detectors shall greatly contribute towards UV communication and other related applications. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Average Sum Rate and Energy Efficiency for D2D Communication Underlaid Cellular Networks
dc:creator: Singh I.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Device-to-Device (D2D) communication has been recognized as one of the key technologies to improve the data rate and reduce the power consumption. In D2D communication, two nearby mobile users establishes the direct link for communication without involving the network infrastructure. A wireless communication with high data rate increases the energy consumption and greenhouse gas emission. To resolve these issues, the D2D communication underlaid cellular network over Nakagami-m fading has been proposed in this paper. In underlaid in-band D2D communication, the licensed frequency bands of cellular network are reused by D2D communication. This introduces additional interference that affect the quality of service but increases the spectral efficiency with low power consumption. The D2D users transmit to their paired receiver by reusing the uplink resource of the cellular network. Average sum rate (ASR) and energy efficiency (EE) have been analyzed for D2D communication underlaid cellular networks. The poisson point process (PPP) and stochastic geometry have been utilized to characterize the random distribution of user equipment. The expressions derived for ASR and EE show the variation over cellular to BS distance, D2D pair distance, and Nakagami fading parameter. The results from this analysis provide a desirable system design parameters that offer the best gains in terms of ASR and EE. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: No Reference Quality Assessment of Blurred Images
dc:creator: Baig M.A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Zakir Husain College of Engineering and Technology

abstract: The overall quality of an image gets affected due to existence of out-of-focus-blur which is very common during photo capturing. In order to know the quality of the blurred image automatically and accurately, a no-reference method is proposed in this paper. The proposed method is based on the fact that if the image that is to be assessed is blurred intentionally, the effect on its structure will vary for different blurriness levels. The structure of image having no traces of blur is altered much more on deliberate blurring than the image which is highly blurred. To measure this structural change, SSIM is employed which gives the structural similarity of the image before and after willful blurring. The structural similarity value so obtained is trained and tested against the ground truth of the image by a machine learning regression algorithm. The proposed method is highly accurate giving Pearson linear correlation coefficient (PLCC) and Spearman rank correlation coefficient (SRCC) value of 0.99 and 0.97 respectively. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Characterization and Global Parameter Extraction of bulk MOSFETs using BSIM-BULK Model
dc:creator: Parihar S.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Shri Govindram Seksaria Institute of Technology and Science

abstract: Measurement and scalable modelcard development methodology for 180 nm Bulk MOSFET technology using BSIM-BULK compact model is presented in this paper. On-wafer device characterization is performed to extract the global parameter set. These devices are fabricated at Semi-Conductor Laboratory (SCL) Chandigarh, India. With the extracted parameter set, BSIM-BULK model accurately predicts the device behavior for entire range of temperature and device dimensions. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Linearity Enhancement of CMOS OTA for High Performance Applications
dc:creator: Prasad N.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad

abstract: In this paper, a new configuration of bias offset Operational Transconductance Amplifier (OTA) and floating gate bias offset OTA have been proposed to increase the linearity range of an OTA. These techniques result in highly linear tunable OTAs with low distortion and very high output impedance. The circuits have been designed and simulated using UMC180 technology file in cadence virtuoso environment with a power supply voltage of ±0.9V. It has been found that the proposed circuits consume power of 11.33 microwatts, and show linearity range of ±0.4V and ±0.75V for bias offset and floating gate bias offset OTAs respectively. Also, the open loop gain is 64dB and 56dB respectively. These techniques results in Total Harmonic Distortion (THD) of -35dB and -45dB for bias offset and floating gate bias offset OTAs respectively at 0.4Vpp input voltage. These results have also been compared and contrasted with the available state-of-art. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Computational Transformation from Web to ebook Archiving
dc:creator: Singhal A.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018
abstract: Offline reading of webpages is gaining importance as users are swamped with data from multiple sites, duplicate entries, storage needs for future use, and various other necessities. The work presented in this paper presents the tool and its schema that is able to satisfy the various requirements of archiving URLs and its linked pages without duplicate entries, indexes the content efficiently and in a user friendly manner of presentation, bookmarks the viewed content for usage later, is able to integrate well with various devices and numerous formats. The presented approach has a targeted methodology which enables it to perform the above mentioned tasks easily without much resource wastage. It achieves its basic aim of providing a quantitative and a well-structured method for offline reading and availability of web pages. The tool is robust, and easy to use. Further, it organizes the content is an easy-to-read manner by storing only linked media and content. Relevant databases were formed for adequate testing. The tool considers the constraints of other existing contrivances and attempts reduce their drawbacks. The proposed tool is found to be satisfactory in its usage requirement and ease-of-use factors too. The final outputs are in the forms of easy-to-read epub and pdf formats for usage in various cross-domain platforms. © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Optimized SHE-PWM Technique for Low Distortion Single Phase MLI for PV Standalone System
dc:creator: Omer P.
prism:publicationName: 2018 5th IEEE Uttar Pradesh Section International Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, UPCON 2018

affiliation.affilname: Punjab Engineering College (Deemed to be University)

abstract: Multilevel inverters are now utilized for various applications and for the control of MLIs various modulation techniques are presented in the literature for low, medium and high power converters, such as fundamental frequency based and PWM based, but few of them are conforming to power quality requirements. In this paper, an optimized SHE-PWM technique is presented for the calculation of switching angles and control of a 7-level inverter. In most of the literature, triplen harmonics are not considered for calculation of angles as they are absent in line voltage, but they are present in phase voltage and in very high magnitude. In the optimized SHE-PWM technique, several transitions per quarter cycle are considered and are optimized for THD minimization up to 49                             <sup>th</sup>                              harmonic using Genetic Algorithm for phase voltage and considering all the odd harmonics up to 49                             <sup>th</sup>                             , keeping in view the objective of keeping individual harmonic components as well as total harmonic distortion within prescribed limits as set by various standards. The feasibility of the proposed method is verified through calculation, simulation and experimentally for a 7-level inverter, where it has been observed that the results obtained from these three studies are in close agreement.                          © 2018 IEEE.

dc:title: Stability analysis of continuous time-delayed system with input saturation
dc:creator: Nisha
